09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Jaehaerys I Targaryen would prove to be as restless a king as ever sat the Iron Throne. Aegon the Conqueror had famously said that the smallfolk needed to see their kings and queens from time to time, so they might lay their griefs and grievances before them. “I mean for them to see me,” Jaehaerys declared, when announcing his first royal progress late in 51 AC. Many more were to follow in the years and decades to come. During the course of his long reign, Jaehaerys would spend more days and nights guesting with one lord or another, or holding audience in some market town or village, than at Dragonstone and the Red Keep combined. And oft as not, Alysanne was with him, her silvery dragon soaring beside his great beast of burnished bronze.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Jaehaerys I Targaryen and his father, Aegon the Conqueror had just returned from their first royal progress. Making stops at the Iron Throne, Dragonstone and the Red Keep along the way, Jaehaerys was determined to prove that he could be a good king like his father. He spent long days guesting and holding audience with restless smallfolk as a way of announcing that he was following in Aegon’s footsteps. On their return to Dragonstone, they were greeted by Ser Myles Smallwood and Lord Velaryon at the docks. Lord Velaryon said they should take some time to rest before embarking on another journey. However, Jaimehaerys had bigger plans. With a small gathering of lords and ladies including Prudence Celtigar and Septa Ysabel present in Maegor Towers, he declared that he would visit far-off lands such as Sunspear or The Arbor to find new allies for his soon-to-be kingdom. When all agreed upon it, Jaehaerys knew this decision would change everything following him forever.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Aegon the Conqueror had been accustomed to taking as many as a thousand knights, men-at-arms, grooms, cooks, and other servants with him on the road. Whilst undeniably grand to behold, such processions created many difficulties for the lords honored by royal visits. So many men were difficult to house and feed, and if the king wished to go hunting, nearby woods would be overrun. Even the richest lord would oft find himself impoverished by the time the king departed, his cellars drunk dry of wine, his larders empty, and half his maidservants with bastards in their bellies.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Aegon the Conqueror was never shy about taking his royal visits, either. He'd been known to come suddenly-- emerging into a manor hall or marketplace and causing everyone he encountered to behold him with as much awe and respect as ever. During his time visiting for long enough, Aegon was always known to feed the locals and go hunting near by before finding himself impoverished from all the grand hospitality of those rich lords who had drunk dry their cellar of wine during the feast that preceded him. As such, wherever Aegon went-- so did lasting impressions of which were surefire proof that he had been seen by all.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Jaehaerys was resolved to do things differently. No more than one hundred men would accompany him on any progress; twenty knights, the rest men-at-arms and servants. “I do not need to ring myself about with swords so long as I ride Vermithor,” he said. Smaller numbers also allowed him to visit smaller lords, those whose castles had never been large enough to host Aegon. His intent was to see and be seen at more places, but stay at each a shorter time, so as never to become an unwelcome guest.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Jaehaerys was appointed to accompany his grandfather Aegon the Conqueror on his royal visits, despite being younger in age. Despite being smaller and of lesser wealth than the other lords he met, Jaehaerys's progress was grand and rich. Everywhere they went the people fed them famously, taking whatever resources necessary so as not to have their visitors behold a poor house - for some even providing enough wine for Aegon to drink their reserves dry. As they rode through villages both large and small; shorter roads and longer ones in between; Jaehaerys wondered what it would be like if one day he were king himself. He found himself imagining who might accompany him then or how they could spend months riding across meadows and woods to go hunting together – something only kings could do!

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: The king’s first progress was meant to be a modest one, commencing with the crownlands north of King’s Landing and proceeding only as far as the Vale of Arryn. Jaehaerys wanted Alysanne with him, but as Her Grace was with child, he was concerned that their journeys not be too taxing. They began with Stokeworth and Rosby, then moved north along the coast to Duskendale. There, whilst the king viewed Lord Darklyn’s boatyards and enjoyed an afternoon of fishing, the queen held the first of her women’s courts, which were to become an important part of every royal progress to come. Only women and girls were welcome at these audiences; highborn or low, they were encouraged to come forward and share their fears, concerns, and hopes with the young queen.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Jaehaerys and Queen Alysanne had begun their first progress, commencing from King's Landing and proceeding north to Stokeworth, Rosby and the Vale of Arryn. Adored by all they had viewed, it was a joyous time as they shared modest meals with humble villagers while also taxing fishing spots further north along the coast. As they rode into Duskendale, Lord Darklyn offered to accompany them throughout the remainder of their larger tour when compared to Jaehaerys' shorter visits in previous years. They accepted his kind offer and eagerly anticipated what added pleasures his presence may bring to their journey.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: The journey went without incident until the king and queen reached Maidenpool, where they were to be the guests of Lord and Lady Mooton for a fortnight before sailing across the Bay of Crabs to Wickenden, Gulltown, and the Vale. The town of Maidenpool was far famed for the sweetwater pool where legend had it that Florian the Fool had first glimpsed Jonquil bathing during the Age of Heroes. Like thousands of other women before her, Queen Alysanne wished to bathe in Jonquil’s pool, whose waters were said to have amazing healing properties. The lords of Maidenpool had erected a great stone bathhouse around the pool many centuries before, and given it over to an order of holy sisters. No men were allowed to enter the premises, so when the queen slipped into the sacred waters, she was attended only by her ladies-in-waiting, maids, and septas (Edyth and Lyra, who had served beside Septa Ysabel as novices, had both recently sworn their vows to become septas, consecrated in the Faith and devoted to the queen).
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: King Jaehaerys and Queen Alysanne continued their journey as they went to Maidenpool, a town near Bay of Crabs. Lord Mooton greeted the royal couple with hospitality when they reached and the queen was so delighted that she wished for an afternoon swim at Wickenden, a village near Gulltown located in the Vale of Arryn. At Wickenden, she slipped away from her bodyguards accompanied by Florian the Fool, Jonquil Darke, Edyth  Lannister, Lyra Redwyne and Septa Ysabel instead of taking them along for safety reasons. When they reached there under Lady Mooton's guidance it was already evening time but nobody wanted to leave this blessed place as everyone enjoyed bathing together in pure water underneath a starlit sky speaking about life's sacred purposes.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: The goodness of the little queen, the silence of the Starry Sept, and the exhortations of the Seven Speakers had won over most of the Faithful for Jaehaerys and his Alysanne…but there are always some who will not be moved, and amongst the sisters who tended Jonquil’s Pool were three such women, whose hearts were hard with hate. They told one another that their holy waters would be polluted forever were the queen allowed to bathe in them whilst carrying the king’s “abomination” in her belly. Queen Alysanne had only slipped out of her clothing when they fell upon her with daggers they had concealed within their robes.
events: won over most of the Faithful
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Alysanne and her entourage had finally reached the Starry Sept after a long journey. As soon as they arrived, Jaehaerys and Jonquil won over most of the Faithful with their winning words, convincing them that they had come in good faith and would not be polluted by their presence. With one hand on Jonquil's shoulder, Queen Alysanne led the procession inside. But there were those who were hard with hate towards her and to prevent danger, she slipped out of her clothing into the holy waters of Jonquil's Pool in secret. There was no doubt now - little queen had won the hearts of The Most Devout and she defiantly told one another "I will have my son confirmed as king!" from behind concealed walls.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Blessedly, the attackers were no warriors, and they had not taken the courage of the queen’s companions into account. Naked and vulnerable, the Wise Women did not hesitate, but stepped between the attackers and their lady. Septa Edyth was slashed across the face, Prudence Celtigar stabbed through the shoulder, whilst Rosamund Ball took a dagger in the belly that, three days later, proved to be the death of her, but none of the murderous blades touched the queen. The shouts and screams of the struggle brought Alysanne’s protectors running, for Ser Joffrey Doggett and Ser Gyles Morrigen had been guarding the entrance to the bathhouse, never dreaming that the danger lurked within.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Alysanne, who had won over most of the Faithful that day at Starry Sept with her pious speeches and wise words, was taken to a bathhouse for rest by Septa Edyth and Prudence Celtigar. However, little did she know how vulnerable she still was in this moment - the woman's hard hate still bare beneath the surface - so when Ser Joffrey Doggett and Ser Gyles Morrigen side by side blessedly slashed and stabbed at her until they proved victorious in bringing down all of their target; nothing seemed capable of stopping them.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: The Kingsguard made short work of the attackers, slaying two out of hand whilst keeping the third alive for questioning. When encouraged, she revealed that half a dozen others of their order had helped plan the attack, whilst lacking the courage to wield a blade. Lord Mooton hanged the guilty, and might have hanged the innocent as well, save for Queen Alysanne’s intervention.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: The Kingsguard arrived at the bathhouse with Queen Alysanne in tow, and made short work of the attackers, who had expected to find a more vulnerable target. Two were slain out of hand and one was hung for their attempted assault. Prudence Celtigar, Lord Mooton's right-hand woman, revealed to them that there had been plans of an attack in motion - which, thankfully never came to fruition due partly due to Ser Gyles Morrigen's wise intervention. The guilty were brought justice as they were hanged by Septa Edyth upon the order of the Queen - she did not hesitate when it proved necessary.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Jaehaerys was furious. Their visit to the Vale was postponed; instead they returned to the safety of Maegor’s Holdfast. Queen Alysanne would remain within until her child was born, but the experience had shaken her and set her to pondering. “I need a protector of mine own,” she told His Grace. “Your Seven are leal men and valiant, but they are men, and there are places men cannot go.” The king could not disagree. A raven flew to Duskendale that very night, commanding the new Lord Darklyn to send to court his bastard half-sister, Jonquil Darke, who had thrilled the smallfolk during the War for the White Cloaks as the mystery knight known as the Serpent in Scarlet. Still in scarlet, she arrived at King’s Landing a few days later, and gladly accepted appointment as the queen’s own sworn shield. In time, she would be known about the realm as the Scarlet Shadow, so closely did she guard her lady.
events: visit to the Vale was postponed
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Jaehaerys and Queen Alysanne were met with a hero's welcome when they arrived at the Vale after the visit to the Vale was postponed. The Scarlet Shadow, Jonquil Darke and His Grace, Lord Donnel Darklyn, had accepted to be their guards from Maegor’s Holdfast all the way to Duskendale. They were flying furiously towards accepting Vulture Kings as their allies for intervention. Lord Mooton was livid of leal valiants made short work of his lord's killers, having hanged them guilty for planing an attack that failed but ended in slaying two out of hand.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Not long after Jaehaerys and Alysanne returned from Maidenpool and the queen took to her bedchamber, tidings of the most wondrous and unexpected sort came forth from Storm’s End. Queen Alyssa was with child. At forty-four years of age, the Dowager Queen had been thought to be well beyond her childbearing years, so her pregnancy was received as a miracle. In Oldtown, the High Septon himself proclaimed it was a blessing from the gods, “a gift from the Mother Above to a mother who had suffered much, and bravely.”
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: After the visit to the Vale was postponed, Jaehaerys and Queen Alysanne returned from Duskendale to Maidenpool. They had received word that Queen Alyssa was with child, a wondrous event unexpected for someone well beyond her childforty-four years of age. The miracle caused many throughout the Reach and beyond to proclaim their devotion to the King. Lord Velaryon summoned his Kingsguard, Ser Myles Smallwood, Prudence Celtigar, Septa Ysabel to guard them during the journey back to Storm's End and then Oldtown. As news of their return spread like wildfire through dragonstone yards and Maegor Towers alike, people murmured that it must have been Dragonsword upon them which made it possible - Benifer or Septa Maryam perhaps who suffered an attack while they were away. Meanwhile in Dragonstone Lady Alayne Royce shouted praises for Jaehaerys' long reign as she joined Vhagar with Silverwing on a flight over Blackwater Bay towards Maidenpool.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Amidst the joy, there was concern as well. Alyssa was not as strong as she had been; her time as Queen Regent had taken a toll on her, and her second marriage had not brought her the happiness she had once hoped for. The prospect of a child warmed Lord Rogar’s heart, however, and he cast off his anger and repented of his infidelities to stay by his wife’s side. Alyssa herself was fearful, mindful of the last babe she had borne to King Aenys, the little girl Vaella who had died in the cradle. “I cannot suffer that again,” she told her lord husband. “It would rip my heart apart.” But the child, when he came early the following year, would prove to be robust and healthy, a big red-faced boy born with a fuzz of jet-black hair and “a squall that could be heard from Dorne to the Wall.” Lord Rogar, who had long ago put aside any hopes of having children by Alyssa, named his son Boremund.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Alyssa and Lord Rogar married, and soon after their marriage she was pregnant. To the joy of many, she gave birth to a robust and healthy infant - none other than King Aenys, with his jet-black hair clearly rebuking boremund's repented dornish sin. For forty-four years of age, well beyond her childbearing years, it was a wondrous and unexpected miracle. When word returned to Maidenpool from Storm’s End that Queen Alyssa had received a proclamation from Oldtown announcing the birth of Vaella's son most saw this as proof that 'The Stranger' truly had blessed Dorne.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: The gods give grief as well as joy. Long before her mother was brought to term, Queen Alysanne was also delivered of a son, a boy she named Aegon, to honor both the Conqueror and her lost and much lamented brother, the uncrowned prince. All the realm gave thanks, and no one more so than Jaehaerys. But the young prince had come too early. Small and frail, he died three days after birth. So bereft was Queen Alysanne that the maesters feared for her life as well. Forever after, she blamed her son’s death on the women who attacked her at Maidenpool. Had she been allowed to bathe in the healing waters of Jonquil’s Pool, she would say, Prince Aegon would have lived.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Alysanne had been overjoyed when she heard of the birth of her grandson, Prince Aegon, at Maidenpool. Her son Jaehaerys and daughter-in-law Vaella were both satisfied with the healthy and robust baby that was brought to them in Jonquil's Pool. However, despite being thankful for the delivery that Queen Alysanne gave, her joy turned to sorrow when she heard of his death only a few days later. The much lamented prince died from an undisclosed illness which left King Aenys distraught and repenting his sins while Lady Elissa Farman blamed herself as she was the midwife who delivered him. While all suffered during this event, not many were aware of another addition coming into existence in Redfort at Dragonstone – the star-crossed lovers Androw Farman and Lyra happened to be providing each with an abundance of comfort during this time.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Discontent lay heavy upon Dragonstone as well, where Rhaena Targaryen had established her own small court. As they had with Jaehaerys before her, neighboring lords began to seek her out, but the Queen in the East was not her brother. Many of her visitors were received coldly, others turned away without an audience.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Prince Rhaena Targaryen had been deeply affected by Prince Aegon's death, and so she requested to be taken to Dragonstone where she lay for weeks on end. With the council established there, King Jaehaerys sought her out during this time, but unfortunately was received coldly and eventually turned away. He left Dragonstone heavy-hearted as his daughter grieved in peace within its small neighboring walls.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Queen Rhaena’s reunion with her daughter Aerea had not gone well, either. The princess had no memory of her mother, and the queen no knowledge of her child, nor any fondness for the children of others. Aerea had loved the excitement of the Red Keep, with lords and ladies and envoys from queer foreign lands coming and going, knights training in the yards every morning, singers and mummers and fools capering by night, and all the clangor and color and tumult of King’s Landing just beyond the walls. She had loved the attention lavished on her as the heir to the Iron Throne as well. Great lords, gallant knights, bedmaids, washerwomen, and stableboys alike had praised her, loved her, and vied for her favor, and she had been the leader of a pack of young girls of both high and low birth who had terrorized the castle.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Rhaena and her younger sister, Aerea had gone to King's Landing in search of reunion. They had no memory of the place they had never visited nor any fondness for it. But when their arrival was praised and loved by the high and low birth within the Red Keep, none could terrorize them with fear like two queens from queer foreign lands. Knights came gallant, bedmaids curtseyed and even stableboys seemed vied for her favor. Rhaena felt oddly at home yet there was a heavy feeling inside as if she'd been turned away before - just like when she laid established on Dragonstone only to be received coldly and sought out love from Jaehaerys who turned away from her in cruelty.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: All that had been taken from her when her mother carried her off to Dragonstone against her wishes. Compared to King’s Landing, the island was a dull place, sleepy and quiet. There were no girls of her own age in the castle, and Aerea was not allowed to mingle with the daughters of the fisherfolk in the village beneath the walls. Her mother was a stranger to her, sometimes stern and sometimes shy, much given to brooding, and the women who surrounded her seemed to take little interest in Aerea. Of all of them, the only one the princess warmed to was Elissa Farman of Fair Isle, who told her tales of her adventures and promised to teach her how to sail. Lady Elissa was no happier on Dragonstone than Aerea herself, however; she missed her wide western seas and spoke often of returning to them. “Take me with you,” Princess Aerea would say when she did, and Elissa Farman would laugh.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: When Aerea and Elissa Farman arrived at Dragonstone, they found the atmosphere different from what they had experienced in King's Landing. In the capital city, there was always a hustle and bustle of life but here on the island it seemed more subdued and quiet. Although people seemed to mingle around the -brood that had been brought into being with Queen Rhaena ruling over all, there was still something missing for Aerea having not seen her mother in years filled with no memory of her beloved queen nor any fondness for the Stern yet shy woman who had prayed she'd grant favor upon them when she was declared alive again. It wasn't like King's Landing where people were abundantly ready to love and praise her for every deed great or small; here even those who vied for her favor terrorized others from queer foreign lands whilst gallant knights including bedmaids and stableboys born of high and low birth alike ran far too often missed amid such certain dullness that made sleep almost seem desirable an opportunity.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Dragonstone did have one thing King’s Landing largely lacked: dragons. In the great citadel under the shadow of the Dragonmont, more dragons were being born every time the moon turned, or so it seemed. The eggs that Dreamfyre had laid on Fair Isle had all hatched once on Dragonstone, and Rhaena Targaryen had made certain that her daughter made their acquaintance. “Choose one and make him yours,” the queen urged the princess, “and one day you will fly.” There were older dragons in the yards as well, and beyond the walls wild dragons that had escaped the castle made their lairs in hidden caves on the far side of the mountain. Princess Aerea had known Vermithor and Silverwing during her time at court, but she had never been allowed too close to them. Here she could visit with the dragons as often as she liked; the hatchlings, the young drakes, her mother’s Dreamfyre…and greatest of them all, Balerion and Vhagar, huge and ancient and sleepy, but still terrifying when they woke and stirred and spread their wings.
places: hidden caves on the far side of the mountain
events: hatching of eggs that Dreamyfre had laid on Fair Isle
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Princess Aerea Targaryen, Vhagar and Silverwing accompanied their mother Rhaena to the hatching of eggs that Dreamyfre had laid on Fair Isle. She urged her brother, Lord Daemon Velaryon, to visit with them at Dragonstone as she felt lacking without him there. As the hatchlings emerged from the shells and dragons were born, a great, dangerous and terrifying display played out before them. Little did they know what was to come next as they mingle with distant kings and star-crossed lovers in the yards of Dragonmont's hidden caves on the far side of the mountain.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: In the Red Keep, Aerea had loved her horse, her hounds, and her friends. On Dragonstone, the dragons became her friends…her only friends, aside from Elissa Farman…and she began to count the days until she could mount one and fly far, far away.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003:
Princess Aerea was delighted when she and Dragonstone arrived at King's Landing. Though the journey had been long and dangerous, nothing could dampen her enthusiasm as she arrived to hatch eggs that Dreamfyre had laid on Fair Isle. Overcome by a sense of adventure, she urged Rhaena Targaryen to join her in exploring the great citadel. 

Rhaena shared Aerea’s enthusiastic attitude about sightseeing, and eagerly accepted the invitation, quickly enlisting her friend Elissa Farman for company. The three companions happily explored the Red Keep and even ventured up to Dragonmont atop Vhagar or Silverwing - whichever mount could fly them farthest from home – and loved every second of their escapades together.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: King Jaehaerys finally made his progress through the Vale of Arryn in 52 AC, calling at Gulltown, Runestone, Redfort, Longbow Hall, Heart’s Home, and the Gates of the Moon before flying Vermithor up the Giant’s Lance to the Eyrie, as Queen Visenya had done during the Conquest. Queen Alysanne accompanied him for part of his travels, but not all; she had not yet recovered her full strength after childbirth, and the grief that followed. Still, by her good offices, the betrothal of Lady Prudence Celtigar to Lord Grafton of Gulltown was arranged. Her Grace also held a women’s court at Gulltown, and a second at the Gates of the Moon; what she heard and learned would change the laws of the Seven Kingdoms.
places: Heart’s Home, Gates of the Moon, Giant’s Lance, Eyrie
events: Progress through the Vale of Arryn in 52 AC
Betrothal of Lady Prudence Celtigar to Lord Grafton of Gulltown was arranged.
Women's court at Gulltown and a second at the Gates of the Moon.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: King Jaehaerys, Queen Visenya and Queen Alysanne made a grand Progress through the Vale of Arryn in 52 AC. Accompanied by their retinue, including Lord Grafton, Lady Prudence Celtigar and her handmaid Benifer; they visited places such as Runestone, Redfort, Longbow Hall as well as Heart’s Home and Gates of the Moon where women's court was held. They stopped at Gulltown where the betrothal of Lady Prudence Celtigar to Lord Grafton was arranged. It is said that King Jaehaerys called out to Vhagar which had been accompanying them on the aerial journey with his beloved queen Aerea mounted atop it calling "Fly far my love". During his stay here he also heard tales about star-crossed lovers Rhaena Targaryen and Ser Myles Smallwood; learning about their courage in the face of danger.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Men oft speak today of Queen Alysanne’s laws, but this usage is sloppy and incorrect. Her Grace had no power to enact laws, issue decrees, make proclamations, or pass sentences. It is a mistake to speak of her as we might speak of the Conqueror’s queens, Rhaenys and Visenya. The young queen did, however, wield enormous influence over King Jaehaerys, and when she spoke, he listened…as he did upon their return from the Vale of Arryn.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Alysanne, King Jaehaerys and her children Visenya and Rhaenys arrived in the majestic Vale of Arryn. They passed through Redfort, Longbow Hall and Heart’s Home as they rode their dragons towards Runestone. Despite the correct proclamation issued by the king earlier, an enormous crowd had gathered to see them fly across the moonlit sky with their banners unfurling behind them. In Runestone they were met with praise from locals and nobility alike. All heard how Queen Alysanne was determined to make sure that every child spoke properly without any sloppy or incorrect enunciation ever again. Young Lord Grafton of Gulltown could hardly hold his breath while Lady Prudence Celtigar watched from Farman with awe at such an enormous gesture made by a queen who deeply cared for her people's well being throughout Westeros.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: It was the plight of widows throughout the Seven Kingdoms that the women’s courts had made Alysanne aware of. In times of peace especially, it was not uncommon for a man to outlive the wife of his youth, for young men most oft perish upon the battlefield, young women in the birthing bed. Be they of noble birth or humble, men left bereft suchwise would oft after a time take second wives, whose presence in the household was resented by the children of the first wife. Where no bonds of affection existed, upon the man’s own death his heirs could and did expel the widow from the home, reducing her to penury; in the case of lords, the heirs might simply strip away the widow’s prerogatives, incomes, and servants, reducing her to little more than a boarder.
verbs: after a time take second wives
reducing her to little more than a boarder
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Alysanne had made aware the common plight of widows in the Seven Kingdoms- when a man perished, his heirs often set about stripping away prerogatives and reducing the widow to penury. After a time, some took second wives which only increased resentment for those who had been ousted from their homes. Queen Alyssa was thus witness to many expulsions from various households, eagerly striping away prerogatives and reducing her to little more than a boarder. Her grace felt deeply for these women and dispatched agents throughout the realm so she might better understand how widows were treated across all corners of Westeros.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: To rectify these ills, King Jaehaerys in 52 AC promulgated the Widow’s Law, reaffirming the right of the eldest son (or eldest daughter, where there was no son) to inherit, but requiring said heirs to maintain surviving widows in the same condition they had enjoyed before their husband’s death. A lord’s widow, be she a second, third, or later wife, could no longer be driven from his castle, nor deprived of her servants, clothing, and income. The same law, however, also forbade men from disinheriting their children by a first wife in order to bestow their lands, seat, or property upon a later wife or her own children.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: King Jaehaerys promulgated the Widow's Law, requiring that a woman driven by her husband’s death not be left exposed and deprived of her rights. It disinherited any eldest surviving son if his father were to after a time take second wives - something Alysanne had made aware would often lead to resentment from the man toward his widow, who he was then apt to try and expel or strip away of means, reducing her to little more than a boarder in their own home. Lord Velaryon traveled widely throughout the Seven Kingdoms, alerting lords and ladies high and low so that no one might argue ignorance of the King's law; with Lord Myles Smallwood supporting him- they even managed to convince Prudence Celtigar of Dragonstone who had long been reluctant towards change. Septa Ysabel lent her moral guidance in favor of its adoption while Lady Alayne Royce welcomed it as a long denied justice for those bereaved. Queen Alyssa Targaryen decreed formal acceptance on behalf within their castles right alongside Jaehaerys himself- lending solemn conviction behind it all- and soon like wildfire it moved through all corners of Westeros until such horrors as Alysanne endured were neveragain permitted.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Building was the king’s other concern that year. Work continued on the Dragonpit, and Jaehaerys oft visited the site to see the progress with his own eyes. Whilst riding from Aegon’s High Hill to the Hill of Rhaenys, however, His Grace took note of the most lamentable state of his city. King’s Landing had grown too fast, with manses and shops and hovels and rat pits springing up like mushrooms after a hard rain. The streets were close and dark and filthy, with buildings so close to one another that men could clamber from one window to another. The wynds coiled about like drunken snakes. Mud, manure, and nightsoil were everywhere.
events: His Grace took note of the state of his city
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: King Jaehaerys's decree of Widow's Law had been promulgated, which required his subjects to be driven by honor, not deprived of it when it came to disinheriting their eldest surviving sons. With such ambition in mind, His Grace continued his work at Dragonpit as springing up around Aegon's High Hill and the Hill of Rhaenys. But when he visited King’s Landing for the first time since the law was passed on, what he saw was lamentably close to a dark and filthy city coiled with poverty and despair.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: “Would that I could empty the city, knock it down, and build it all anew,” the king told his council. Lacking that power, and the coin such a massive undertaking would have required, Jaehaerys did what he could. Streets were widened, straightened, and cobbled where possible. The worst styes and hovels were torn down. A great central square was carved out and planted with trees, with markets and arcades beneath. From that hub, long wide streets sprung, straight as spears: the King’s Way, the Gods’ Way, the Street of the Sisters, Blackwater Way (or the Muddy Way, as the smallfolk soon renamed it). None of this could be accomplished in a night; work would continue for years, even decades, but it was the year 52 AC when it began, by the king’s command.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Jaehaerys stood in the city, watching as his orders were fulfilled. He'd decreed for styes and hovels to be knocked down and for a central square to be carved out, a space where empties could be planted with massive trees and long-neglected streets widened, straightened, and cobbled anew. The King looked upon the worst of the dark places he'd visited including the Hill of Rhaenys and what had been springing up around at Aegon's High Hill with lamentable closeness. Whatever was being built on his command would be great—Wide enough roads to march troops through in formation; high wide trees shading more than half of each street; bright polished stones forming walls that kept the filth coiled away into one corner of town.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: The cost of rebuilding the city was not inconsequential, and put further strain upon the Crown’s treasury. Those difficulties were exacerbated by the growing unpopularity of the Lord of Air, Rego Draz. In a short time, the Pentoshi master of coin had become as widely loathed as his predecessor, though for different reasons. He was said to be corrupt, taking the king’s gold to fatten his own purse, a charge Lord Rego treated with derision. “Why should I steal from the king? I am twice as rich as he is.” He was said to be godless, for he did not worship the Seven. Many a queer god is worshipped in Pentos, but Draz was known to keep but one, a small household idol like unto a woman great with child, with swollen breasts and a bat’s head. “She is all the god I need,” was all he would say upon the matter. He was said to be a mongrel, an assertion he could not deny, for all Pentoshi are part Andal and part Valyrian, mixed with the stock of slaves and older peoples long forgotten. Most of all, he was resented for his wealth, which he did not deign to conceal but flaunted with his silken robes, ruby rings, and gilded palanquin.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: As the city was rebuilt by Lord of Air Rego Draz and Pentoshi master of coin according to their king’s command, their rebuilding effort had rapidly began to put a strain on the city's coffers due to its cost. Many had started to take notice, growing ever more hostile towards those in power at the king’s expense. The lord flaunted his wealth gained from taking gold from the witless king—the consequential popularity for these acts being one so damnedly unpopular it was almost unheard of. Furthermore, some believed that such corrupt dealings with godless queer intrigues as great with child Queens as well as swollen breasts befitting more an old bat'shead could not possibly be tolerated. People began to resent how easily he seemed to snatch up golden coins left and right, never questioning if it truly did belong solely and wholly in his hands .

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: That Lord Rego Draz was an able master of coin even his enemies could not deny, but the challenge of paying for the completion of the Dragonpit and the rebuilding of King’s Landing strained even his talents. The taxes on silk, spice, and crenellations alone could not answer, so Lord Rego reluctantly imposed a new levy: a gate fee, required of anyone entering or leaving the city, collected by the guards on the city’s gates. Additional fees were assessed for horses, mules, donkeys, and oxen, and wagons and carts were taxed heaviest of all. Given the amount of traffic that came and went from King’s Landing every day, the gate tax proved to be highly lucrative, bringing in more than enough coin to meet the need…but at considerable cost to Rego Draz himself, as the grumbling against him increased tenfold.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Lord Rego Draz, the Lord of Air and master of King's Landing's reconstruction, reluctantly imposed an assessment on Pentos in order to be able to collect the funds he needed for his new arrangement. Having already brought such strain upon the city due to his increased demands laid out by rebuilding King’s landing, tension was even further heightened when their heavily assessed taxes were flaunted at court. This consequential unpopularity only seemed to make him more corrupt in the eyes of those watching—straining relations between Pentos and its godless queer yet great with child who bore swollen breasts not seen since “the bat’shead rebellion” so many years ago could be clearly sensed amidst resented whispers throughout Dragonpit and King's Landing alike.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: A long summer, plentiful harvests, and peace and prosperity both at home and abroad helped to blunt the edge of the discontent, however, and as the year drew to a close, Queen Alysanne brought the king splendid news. Her Grace was once again with child. This time, she vowed, no enemies would come near her. Plans for a second royal progress had already been made and announced before the queen’s condition became known. Though Jaehaerys decided at once that he would remain by his wife’s side until the babe was born, Alysanne would not have it. He must go, she insisted.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Alysanne and King Jaehaerys were touring the realm on their royal progress when they reached Dragonstone. Queen Alysanne, with child and determined to remain at Dragonstone until she gave birth, soon drew the attention of Lord Rego Draz, who had been tasked by her husband before his passing to ensure any taxes imposed were assessed fairly. With a lacklustre collection of funds brought in and a strained relationship with newly appointed lords, Queen Alysanne reluctantly increased taxes to better serve the people - heavy though the measure may have seemed. Along for this journey was Septa Maryam, Benifer her Kingsguard, Lord Velaryon their honored guest Ser Myles Smallwood atop Braavar's Pride, Prudence Celtigar from House Pepperking greeted them fruitfully at The Three Towers; Supta Ysabel greeted those of them coming to Starry Sept near Gods Eye in order to bless the union between these two star-crossed lovers.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: And so he did. The coming of the new year saw the king taking to the sky again on Vermithor, this time for the riverlands. His progress began with a stay at Harrenhal as a guest of its new lord, the nine-year- old Maegor Towers. From there he and his retinue moved on to Riverrun, Acorn Hall, Pinkmaiden, Atranta, and Stoney Sept. At his queen’s request, Lady Jennis Templeton traveled with the king to hold women’s courts at Riverrun and Stoney Sept in her place. Alysanne remained in the Red Keep, presiding over council meetings in the king’s absence, and holding audience from a velvet seat at the base of the Iron Throne.
events: taking to the sky again on Vermithor
verbs: began with a stay at Harrenhal as guest of its new lord,
moved on to Riverrun, Acorn Hall, Pinkmaiden, Atranta and Stoney Sept.
traveled with the king to hold women’s courts in her place.
remained in the Red Keep, presiding over council meetings and holding audience from a velvet seat at base of Iron Throne.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003:
King Jaehaerys and Queen Alysanne had set out on a royal progress early in the new year, with their nine-year-old daughter, Lady Jennis Templeton. They did so with best wishes from King's Landing and headed to Harrenhal as guests of its new lord. From there, the royal court moved on to Riverrun, Acorn Hall, Pinkmaiden, Atranta and finally Stoney Sept. Being with child at the time created some difficulties but Queen Alysanne insisted that any issues were minor ones compared to what it meant for her people -- a long period of plentiful peace and prosperity. 

On each stop they made along the way they received extravagant welcomes from proud lords eager to demonstrate both their loyalty to House Targaryen and skill in throwing festivals full of pageantry in honor of their sovereigns. As such festivities carried on each night under starry skies, King Jaehaerys would often take to the sky again on Vermithor while Queen Alysanne began holding women’s courts in her place – much like those organized by her mother before her - that decried injustice across regions visited by them. Meanwhile she remained firmly rooted in duty at Red Keep when not traveling; presiding over council meetings and holding audience from a velvet seat at base of Iron Throne behind which stood ever-watchful eyes of Kingsguard led by Lord Velaryon alongside Ser Myles Smallwood whose swift counsel saved many a situation during tumultuous years that followed fall of Aegon Targaryen conqueror months after birth of his heir Aegon who perished defending him later only at Kings' Landing battlefield unceremoniously known as 'Battle Beneath The Stars'.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: As Her Grace grew great with child, just across Blackwater Bay by the Gullet another woman was delivered of another child whose birth, whilst less noted, would in time be of great significance to the lands of Westeros and the seas that lay beyond. On the isle of Driftmark, Daemon Velaryon’s eldest son became a father for the first time when his lady wife presented him with a handsome, healthy boy. The babe was named Corlys, after the great-great-uncle who had served so nobly as the Lord Commander of the first Kingsguard, but in the years to come the people of Westeros would come to know this new Corlys better as the Sea Snake.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Her Grace Daemon Velaryon and his beloved wife grew great with child before the year’s end. After delivering of a handsome, healthy and nobly named Corlys in Blackwater Bay, presented for announcement to the citizens Gullet, Lord Donnel Hightower and Driftmark. Benifer, Septa Maryam and her Kingsguard cousin Ser Myles Smallwood attended the occasion – Lord Donnel's brother filled up as Captain of her guard too. Queen Alysanne was present at this joyous occasion too..

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: The queen’s own child followed in due course. She was brought to bed during the seventh moon of 53 AC, and this time she gave birth to a strong and healthy child, a girl she named Daenerys. The king was at Stoney Sept when word reached him. He mounted Vermithor and flew back to King’s Landing at once. Though Jaehaerys had hoped for another son to follow him upon the Iron Throne, it was plain that he doted on his daughter from the moment he first took her in his arms. The realm delighted in the little princess as well…everywhere, that is, save on Dragonstone.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Daenerys was brought to Stoney Sept, where she followed with king Jaehaerys and his court. The moment of birth was close at hand; the queen doted on her unborn child and everyone in the palace hoped for a strong and healthy babe. When the time finally came to present the baby, they saw that she had grown great with Child as noble, handsome, and healthy as could be. They named him accordingly - after his father King Jaehaerys -  mounted their dragons Vhagar, Silverwing and Dreamfyre, flew from Stoney Sept to King’s Landing to Dragonstone showing off their bundle of joy. All along their route the people cheered for this queen who had so duely brought about such a grand heir to her husband’s throne.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Aerea Targaryen, the daughter of Aegon the Uncrowned and his sister Rhaena, was eleven years of age, and had been heir to the Iron Throne for as long as she could remember (but for the three days that separated Prince Aegon’s birth from his death). A strong-willed, bold- tongued, fiery young girl, Aerea delighted in the attention that came with being a queen-in-waiting, and was not pleased to find herself displaced by the newborn princess.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: The birth of Princess Rhaena, the younger sister of Aerea Targaryen and Aegon the Uncrowned, was remembered even years later. Displaced from their Iron Throne due to her strong-willed, bold-tongued and fiery nature, both Aerea and Aegon had been brought to Stoney Sept by King Jaehaerys before being flown away to King's Landing due to Maeger’s attack. Queen Daenerys hoped for a healthy baby but when it seemed to be due soon she had her own dragon Vhagar mount her towards Dragonstone with his dragonmount friend Silverwing following closely behind. With the news that Maester Benifer delivered at Dragonstone about princesses birth everyone in court doted upon her Princess Aerea whom they adored like their own child.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Her mother, Queen Rhaena, likely shared these feelings, but she held her tongue and spoke no word of it even to her closest confidants. She had trouble enough in her own hall at the time, for a rift had opened between her and her beloved Elissa Farman. Denied any part of the incomes of Fair Isle by her brother Lord Franklyn, Elissa asked the Dowager Queen for gold sufficient to build a new ship in the shipyards of Driftmark, a large, swift vessel meant to sail the Sunset Sea. Rhaena denied her request. “I could not bear for you to leave me,” she said, but Lady Elissa heard only, “No.”
events: rift opened between Elissa and Queen Rhaena
denied of incomes of Fair Isle by Lord Franklyn
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Rhaena, Elissa Farman and Lord Franklyn stood together in the great hall of Fair Isle overlooking the Sunset Sea. The rift that had opened between Elissa and Queen Rhaena following her birth of Princess Aerea had long since been shared over, held by a powerful bond between the two women. As they spoke, it was clear to all who witnessed them that something special connected them - something even stronger than their beloved dragons Vhagar and Silverwing. Asking Lord Franklyn to build a ship so they could sail away anytime they wished, they were dismayed when he denied their reasonable request outright. No longer standing as close as before, Queen Rhaena channeled her strong-willed personality as she boldly spoke out against him with fiery words. Though it seemed like an ending for these star-crossed lovers, only time would tell if this chapter would prove to be simply another chapter on their closest way to happily ever after.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: With the hindsight of history to guide us, we can look back and see that all the portents were there, ominous signs of difficult days ahead, but even the archmaesters of the Conclave saw none of that as they reflected on the year about to end. Not one of them realized that the year ahead would be amongst the darkest in the long reign of Jaehaerys I Targaryen, a year so marked by death, division, and disaster that the maesters and smallfolk alike would come to call it the Year of the Stranger.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003:
Queen Rhaena, Elissa Farman and Lord Franklyn had just returned from the Conclave, where Jaehaerys I Targaryen had looked back on history and realised that the year of the stranger was marked by death, division and disaster. Little did anyone know what was to come in Fair Isle when the rift opened between Elissa and Queen Rhaena or how Lord Franklyn would deny them their incomes. 

Now that they had been sent away with no option but to build a ship on Sunset Sea and sail to their destinies, all they shared were feelings of an ominous future full of difficult times. As they parted ways with their beloved Queen, a feeling of darkness blanketed them like never before. Who could have predicted that this dark night would be one of the darkest moments in Westerosi history?

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: The first death of 54 AC came within days of the celebrations that marked the coming of the new year, as Septon Oswyck passed in his sleep. He was an old man and had been failing for some time, but his passing cast a pall over the court all the same. At a time when the Queen Regent, the King’s Hand, and the Faith had all opposed the marriage of Jaehaerys and Alysanne, Oswyck had agreed to perform the rites for them, and his courage had not been forgotten. At the king’s request, his remains were interred on Dragonstone, where he had served so long and so faithfully.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: As Queen Regent, Septon Oswyck had overseen the interment of Jaehaerys I Targaryen at Dragonstone. The old man's passing marked a troubled end to an era of difficult history and hindsight of what saw in his lifetime only reminded him of the darkest times - death, division and disaster. As he passed through the yards of Dragonstone, he realized it would be Alysanne who must take up King's Hand now that Jaehaerys was gone. It was her brother as much as any, who held firm to these old walls even in failing days; she had it within her to carry on his legacy no matter how ominous the winds may howl.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: The Red Keep was still in mourning when the next blow fell, though at the time it seemed an occasion for joy. A raven from Storm’s End delivered an astonishing message: Queen Alyssa was once again with child, at the age of forty-six. “A second miracle,” Grand Maester Benifer proclaimed when he told the king the news. Septon Barth, who had taken on Oswyck’s duties after his death, was more doubtful. Her Grace had never completely recovered from the birth of her son Boremund, he cautioned; he questioned whether she still had strength enough to carry a child to term. Rogar Baratheon was elated at the prospect of another son, however, and foresaw no difficulties. His wife had given birth to seven children, he insisted. Why not an eighth?
events: proclamation of news from Storm’s End
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Alyssa, Grand Maester Benifer and Septon Barth had made their way from the Red Keep to Storm’s End in order to deliver the news of King Jaehaerys' passing. Oswyck was already there mourning his longtime friend and arranged for a proclamation of news from Storm’s End. As Boremund Baratheon questioned the motives of those around him, Rogar Baratheon cautioned that now was not the time for such inquiries as they were still in midst of mourning. Despite all this, Grand Maester Benifer insisted on delivering the astonishing news; They were witnesses to a second miracle—the birth of twin dragons at Dragonstone! The elated crowd immediately offered up prayers to lend favor with both gods and dragons alike.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: On Dragonstone, problems of another sort were coming to a head. Lady Elissa Farman could suffer life upon the island no more. She had heard the sea calling, she told Queen Rhaena; it was time for her to take her leave. Never one to make a show of her emotions, the Queen in the East received the news stone-faced. “I have asked you to stay,” she said. “I will not beg. If you would go, go.” Princess Aerea had none of her mother’s restraint. When Lady Elissa came to say her farewells, the princess wept and clung to her leg, pleading with her to stay, or failing that, to take her along. “I want to be with you,” Aerea said, “I want to sail the seas and have adventures.” Lady Elissa shed a tear as well, we are told, but she pushed the princess away gently and told her, “No, child. Your place is here.”
events: Lady Elissa coming to say farewells
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: The lady Elissa Farman had arrived at Dragonstone to say her farewells, but Queen Rhaena and Princess Aerea did not receive her as regally as she would have hoped. They could tell from the somber expression on Lady Elissa's face that she was suffering; yet despite this, the Queen remained stone-faced, restrained in her composure. Not wanting to show any emotion to their guest, both of them called for their ladies-in-waiting whilst pleading for time alone with Elissa. Tears soon started streaming down Elissa's cheeks as she clung onto Rhaena and Aerea begging not to be sent away just yet. Even through a thin veil of tears, they could see the sorrow in her eyes emanating like a beacon in smoke-filled sky - an emotional dusk of sand settling over the Stone Drum yard. Pulling back gently they bid Lady Elissa Farman a tearful goodbye, wishing that their paths would cross again one day - unaware that history was going to write those same words into legend far sooner than anyone had realized.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Elissa Farman departed for Driftmark the next morning. From there she took ship across the narrow sea to Pentos. Thereafter she made her way overland to Braavos, whose shipwrights were far famed, but Rhaena Targaryen and Princess Aerea had no notion of her final destination. The queen believed she had gone no farther than Driftmark. Lady Elissa had good reason for wanting more distance between her and the queen, however. A fortnight after her departure, Ser Merrell Bullock, still commander of the castle garrison, brought three terrified grooms and the keeper of the dragon yard into Rhaena’s presence. Three dragon eggs were missing, and days of searching had not turned them up. After questioning every man who had access to the dragons closely, Ser Merrell was convinced that Lady Elissa had made off with them.
events: Took ship across the narrow sea to Pentos
Made her way overland to Braavos
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Lady Elissa Farman bid her farewells to Queen Rhaena and Princess Aerea of Dragonstone, departing for Driftmark with a heavy heart. With three dragon eggs missing, she took ship across the narrow sea to Pentos and made her way overland to Braavos in search of answers with the help of Ser Merrell Bullock, one of the King'sguard. During their journey many perilous dangers lay ahead of them as well as strange and mysterious allies who could guide them on their quest towards finding the missing eggs.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: If this betrayal by one she had loved wounded Rhaena Targaryen she hid it well, but there was no hiding her fury. She commanded Ser Merrell to question the grooms and stableboys more sharply. When the questioning proved fruitless, she relieved him of his command and expelled him from Dragonstone, together with his son Ser Alyn, and a dozen other men she found suspicious. She even went so far as to summon her husband, Androw Farman, demanding to know if he had been complicit in his sister’s crime. His denials only goaded her to more rage, until their shouts could be heard echoing through the halls of Dragonstone. She sent men to Driftmark, only to learn that Lady Elissa had sailed to Pentos. She sent men to Pentos, but there the trail went cold.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Wounded from her betrayal, Rhaena Targaryen hid and ordered Ser Merrell and Ser Alyn to take Princess Aerea with them to Driftmark. Her cousin Androw Farman, accompanied by Lady Elissa, was commanded by his king to expel the princess from Pentos on a ship across the Narrow Sea. The questioning proved fruitless as denials were made in regards to the missing three dragon eggs. Rhaena watched as they departed for Driftmark with a great fury in her heart that only intensified when summoned by the Lord of Dragonstone demanding answers. She reluctantly sailed back with them, but decided upon going cold instead once they went into hiding on an island in Braavos.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Only then did Rhaena Targaryen mount Dreamfyre to fly to the Red Keep and inform her brother of what had transpired. “Elissa had no love for dragons,” she told the king. “It was gold she wanted, gold to build a ship. She will sell the eggs. They are worth—” “—a fleet of ships.” Jaehaerys had received his sister in his solar, with only Grand Maester Benifer present to bear witness to what was said. “If those eggs should hatch, there will be another dragonlord in the world, one not of our own house.” “They may not hatch,” Benifer said. “Not away from Dragonstone. The heat…it is known, some dragon eggs simply turn to stone.” “Then some spicemonger in Pentos will find himself possessed of three very costly stones,” Jaehaerys said. “Elsewise…the birth of three young dragons is not a thing that can easily be kept secret. Whoever has them will want to crow. We must have eyes and ears in Pentos, Tyrosh, Myr, all the Free Cities. Offer rewards for any word of dragons.” “What do you mean to do?” his sister Rhaena asked him. “What I must. What you must. Do not think to wash your hands of this, sweet sister. You wanted Dragonstone and I gave it to you, and you brought this woman there. This thief.” The long reign of Jaehaerys I Targaryen was a peaceful one, for the most part; such wars as he fought were few and short. Let no man mistake Jaehaerys for his father, Aenys, however. There was nothing weak about him, nothing indecisive, as his sister Rhaena and Grand Maester Benifer witnessed then, when the king went on to say, “Should the dragons turn up, anywhere from here to Yi Ti, we will demand their return. They were stolen from us, they are ours by right. If that demand should be denied, then we must needs go and get them. Take them back if we can, kill them if not. No hatchlings can hope to stand against Vermithor and Dreamfyre.”
verbs: take them back if we can, kill them if not.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Rhaena Targaryen had finally arrived to the Red Keep after being summoned by her brother, Jaehaerys I Targaryen. She was accompanied by Grand Maester Benifer and her half-brother Aenys. As they entered the throne room, Rhaena's fury was evident as she crossed an accusing gaze at all present. They had been called in to discuss Elissa's theft of dragon eggs from Dragonstone and if she could be brought to justice or if they would have wash their hands off this incident. Jaehaerys offered a proposition - he'd give them to Rhaena and she'd go across the continent travelling through Pentos and Tyrosh, Myr adn Free Cities even Yi Ti if necessary, bring back the stolen eggs or bring back news of their whereabouts so that action can be taken against those who stole them peacefully with no violence involved for he thought it too weak for his indecisive nature refused bloodshed in such matters .

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: “And Silverwing?” asked Rhaena. “Our sister—” “—had no part in this. I will not put her at risk.” The Queen in the East smiled then. “She is Rhaenys, and I am Visenya. I have never thought otherwise.” Grand Maester Benifer said, “You are speaking of waging war across the narrow sea, Your Grace. The costs—” “—must needs be borne. I will not allow Valyria to rise again. Imagine what the triarchs of Volantis would do with dragons. Let us pray it never comes to that.” With that His Grace ended the audience, cautioning the others not to speak of the missing eggs. “No one must know of this but we three.”
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Rhaena Targaryen had mounted her dragon Silverwing, against the cautioning of Grand Maester Benifer. Waging War Across Narrow Sea was the only thing that Rhaena knew could help bring peace to Westeros. With Queen in the East and Visenya backing her, she soared out over the Valyrian sea towards Volantis to demand their return of what Elissa had stolen from them - dragon eggs. If they offered them peacefully then great, but if not, Rhaena would have to take them back by force no matter how weak or indecisive they were. Praying that this journey would end better than it begun, she silently bore forward with a newfound determination

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: It was too late for such cautions, though. On Dragonstone, the theft was common knowledge, even amongst the fisherfolk. And fisherfolk, as is known, sail to other islands, and thus the whispers spread. Benifer, acting through the Pentoshi master of coin, who had agents in every port, reached out across the narrow sea as the king had commanded…“paying good coin to bad men” (in the words of Rego Draz) for any news of dragon eggs, dragons, or Elissa Farman. A small host of whisperers, informers, courtiers, and courtesans produced hundreds of reports, a score of which proved to be of value to the Iron Throne for other reasons…but every rumor of the dragon eggs proved worthless.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: The rumor of Rego Draz, a thief from Dragonstone, had spread far and wide in the Narrow Sea and reached even distant places such as Volantis. The tale was known to be true by common knowledge, as Grand Maester Benifer paid out hefty sums to Pay Rhaena’s brother, Rogar, for his theft after reaching small islands across the sea. Eventually with the advice of Lord Velaryon, Queen in the East gathered her Kingsguard and sailed off towards Dragonstone; not knowing what awaited them on their journey or when they would return.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: We know now that Lady Elissa made her way to Braavos after Pentos, though not before taking on a new name. Having been driven from Fair Isle and disowned by her brother Lord Franklyn, she took on a bastard name of her own devising, calling herself Alys Westhill. Under that name, she secured an audience with the Sealord of Braavos. The Sealord’s menagerie was far famed, and he was glad to buy the dragon eggs. The gold she received in return she entrusted to the Iron Bank, and used it to finance the building of the Sun Chaser, the ship she had dreamed of for many a year.
events: disowned by her brother Lord Franklyn
an audience with the Sealord of Braavos
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Lady Elissa had secured her freedom by taking on a new name and was now headed to Braavos. Having been disowned by her brother Lord Franklyn, she made her way and managed to secure an audience with the Sealord of Braavos. After spending weeks gathering funds from some of the wealthiest merchants, Lady Elissa was able to buy dragon eggs from mysterious traders in Fair Isle. With few resources available in Dragonstone, she used finances that had been entrusted to her for building of the Sun Chaser. Knowing that it wasn't quite enough for the project, Alys Westhill - a Pentosi merchant at Sea Dragon Tower -reluctantly agreed to finance more for them in return for Lady Elissa's glad tidings about his business reaching farwide places and paying him back as soon as possible. Despite rumors common among sailors and Folks of Seven Kingdoms being known about their plans, Lady Elissa remained narrow-minded and small in scale while starting their venture into dangerous waters.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: None of this was known on Westeros at the time, however, and soon enough King Jaehaerys had a fresh concern. In the Starry Sept of Oldtown, the High Septon had collapsed whilst ascending a flight of steps to his bedchamber. He was dead before he reached the bottom. All across the realm, bells in every sept sang a dolorous song. The Father of the Faithful had gone to join the Seven.
events: ascending a flight of steps to his bedchamber
dead before he reached the bottom
bells in every sept sang dolorous song
Father of the Faithful had gone to join the Seven
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: King Jaehaerys, known as the Elder and beloved throughout Westeros, was headed to the Starry Sept of Oldtown with much concern from the High Septon. Suddenly he collapsed while ascending a flight of steps to his bedchamber and when it became know in the realm that he had reached his final destination dead before he reached the bottom, bells in every sept sang a dolorous song announcing that Father of the Faithful had gone to join the Seven. Queen Visenya sent her Kingsguard immediately on hearing news of fresh misfortune in Westeros, ordering them reinforce Lord Velaryon at Dragonstone, who will defend against any attackers alongside Lady Alayne Royce and Lady Prudence Celtigar.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: The king had no time for prayer or grieving, though. As soon as His Holiness was interred, the Most Devout would be assembling in the Starry Sept to choose his successor, and Jaehaerys knew that the peace of the realm depended on the new man continuing the policies of his predecessor. The king had his own candidate for the crystal crown: Septon Barth, who had come to oversee the Red Keep’s library, only to become one of his most trusted advisors. It took half the night for Barth himself to persuade His Grace of the folly of his choice; he was too young, too little known, too unorthodox in his opinions, not even one of the Most Devout. He had no hope of being chosen. They would need another candidate, one more acceptable to his brothers of the Faith.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: An air of solemnity hung over Starry Sept as King Jaehaerys, His Holiness the High Septon, and the Most Devout of Westeros interred his body to rest in the sept near Red Keep's library. Despite much discussion amongst those present about choosing his successor, no one was able to convince His Holiness or persuade him to accept any other but Septon Barth - a man known for his devoutness and trusted by the young king before he passed away - despite being little-known outside the Seven Kingdoms. Even in death, he favoured an unorthodox approach; something which would have endeared him further with both religious followers and many commoners alike.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: The king and the lords of the council were agreed on one thing, however; they must needs do all they could to make certain that Septon Mattheus was not chosen. His tenure in King’s Landing had left a legacy of mistrust behind it, and Jaehaerys could neither forgive nor forget his words at the gates of Dragonstone.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: When King Jaehaerys had finished interring His Holiness, the Most Devout set out to convince and persuade the lords of the council to be choosing his successor. After arriving in King's Landing, Septon Mattheus was chosen as His Grace agreed upon it after all agreeing to do what is necessary to make certain that he would forgive and forget about their certain previous behavior.  Lord Daemon Velaryon was among those lords of the council who thought that this young and little known Septon could help heal their kingdom, with his unorthodox methods. He traveled from Dragonstone with Lady Alayne Royce and Queen Alyssa by his side in order assist him for this complicated task ahead.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Rego Draz suggested that some well-placed bribes might produce the desired result. “Spread enough gold amongst these Most Devout and they will choose me,” he japed, “though I would not want the job.” Daemon Velaryon and Qarl Corbray advocated a show of force, though Lord Daemon wished to send his fleet, whilst Lord Qarl offered to lead an army. Albin Massey, the bent-backed master of laws, wondered if Septon Mattheus might suffer the same fate as the High Septon who had made such trouble for Aenys and Maegor; a sudden, mysterious death. Septon Barth, Grand Maester Benifer, and Queen Alysanne were horrified by all these proposals, and the king rejected them out of hand. He and the queen would go to Oldtown at once, he decided instead. His High Holiness had been a leal servant to the gods and a staunch friend to the Iron Throne, it was only right that they be there to see him laid to rest. The only way to reach Oldtown in time was by dragon.
events: the same fate as the High Septon who had made such trouble for Aenys and Maegor
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: The Oldtown citadel was abuzz as Queen Alysanne gathered Rego Draz, Daemon Velaryon, Qarl Corbray, Albin Massey, Septon Mattheus, Septon Barth and Grand Maester Benifer to discuss their plan. The queen proposed that they send a fleet to Dragonstone and hire mercenaries to defend the island from further attack. Rego suggested they might offer the same fate as that of High Septon who had caused so much trouble for King Aenys and King Maegor before him. While some advocated for such a show of force others like Lord Daemon rejected it out of fear for his leal subjects on Dragonstone yet the queen’s decision was laid in stone: well-placed hired fighters would be needed if they desired order restored in Westeros once more. As Jaehaerys japed in favour of his mother's decision even he could not have imagined just how far a simple show of force would take them all.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: All the lords of the council, even Septon Barth, were made uneasy by the thought of the king and queen alone in Oldtown. “There are still those amongst my brothers who do not love Your Grace,” Barth pointed out. Lord Daemon agreed, and reminded Jaehaerys of what had befallen the queen at Maidenpool. When the king insisted that he would have the protection of the Hightower, uneasy glances were exchanged. “Lord Donnel is a schemer and a sulker,” said Manfryd Redwyne. “I do not trust him. Nor should you. He does what he thinks best for himself, his house, and Oldtown, and cares not a fig for anyone or anything else. Not even for his king.”
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: All the lords of the council made uneasy by Lord Donnel's suggestion that they hire a show of force to Oldtown and Maidenpool in retaliation for the same fate as the High Septon who had made such trouble for Aenys and Maegor. Septon Barth pointed out that Jaehaerys had offered to lead an army himself. Lady Alayne Royce reminded everyone that Maegor had also employed well-placed spies, as Queen Alysanne desired. But Lord Manfryd Redwyne insisted on a show of force, saying there was nothing better than dragons when it came to getting a message across. Japed Lord Daemon Velaryon, "but what happens when you need more leal supporters?". This caused both Septon Mattheus and Grand Maester Benifer to look horrified at his bent-backed figure - could he be suggesting warfare? The rest just exchanged uneasy glances; eager for someone else to decide how best to handle this situation, after all laying siege was not something any of them desired lightly.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: “Then I must convince him that what is best for his king is what is best for himself, his house, and Oldtown,” said Jaehaerys. “I believe I can do that.” So he ended the discussion and gave orders for their dragons to be brought forth.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Jaehaerys and his king made their way to Oldtown in order to try and convince the lords of the council to believe that they had justice on their side. No sooner had they arrived than Jaehaerys gave orders to bring forth Benifer - a renowned septa from Dragonstone - and Septa Maryam, her seat at The High Tower, in an effort to quell any unease present amongst the lords. Even this did not seem enough for Lord Donnel who insisted that Lady Alayne Royce and Queen Alyssa be there too- much to Jaeharys' worry.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Even for a dragon, the flight from King’s Landing to Oldtown is a long one. The king and queen stopped twice along the way, once at Bitterbridge and once at Highgarden, resting overnight and taking counsel with their lords. The lords of the council had insisted that they take some protection at the very least. Ser Joffrey Doggett flew with Alysanne, and the Scarlet Shadow, Jonquil Darke, with Jaehaerys, so as to balance the weight each dragon carried.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: As the sun set on Oldtown, the King and Queen took their leave after a long day of convencing his people to believe in his orders. They stopped at Bitterbridge for a night’s rest before continuing their flight towards King’s Landing. Accompanying them were Ser Joffrey Doggett, loyal to the throne, as well as Alysanne and Scarlet Shadow; two star-crossed lovers who had been bound by Jonquil Darke and Jaehaerys' handfasting ceremony. With each other for courage, they all made their way across Westeros with Maester Culiper taking lead of the mission through trading towns and hidden caves on the far side of mountains from Dragonstone to Highgarden.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: The unexpected arrival of Vermithor and Silverwing at Oldtown brought thousands to the streets to point and stare. No word of their coming had been sent ahead, and there were many in the city who were frightened, wondering what this might portend…none, mayhaps, more than Septon Mattheus, who turned pale when he was told. Jaehaerys brought down Vermithor on the wide marble plaza outside the Starry Sept, but it was his queen who made the city gasp when Silverwing alighted atop the Hightower itself, the beating of her wings fanning the flames of its famous beacon.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Vermithor and Silverwing's arrival at Oldtown point blankly in the sky made the city gasp. It was unexpected, but as they alighted atop the Hightower, Jaehaerys and Septon Mattheus fanned the flames of gossip by their presence there. People were frightened; rumors began to spread rapidly that when Jaehaerys left King's Landing he would take what remained of his loyal houseguard Scarlet Shadow with him and fly to run away from Queen Alysanne in Oldtown. However, no one could have guessed that Vermithor and Silverwing had sent a pair of Septas ahead to make sure Lady Prudence Celtigar opened up Lord Hightower's court as well as prepared for such an unexpected landing.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Though the High Septon’s funeral rites were the purported reason for their visit, His High Holiness had already been interred in the crypts beneath the Starry Sept by the time the king and queen arrived. Jaehaerys gave a eulogy nonetheless, addressing a huge crowd of septons, maesters, and smallfolk in the plaza. At the end of his remarks, he announced that he and the queen would remain in Oldtown until the new High Septon had been chosen “so we might ask for his blessing.” As Archmaester Goodwyn wrote afterward, “The smallfolk cheered, the maesters nodded sagely, and the septons looked at one another and thought on dragons.”
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: As soon as the High Septon, His High Holiness, arrived in Oldtown with Queen Jaehaerys and Octon Mattheus by his side, the people of Oldtown cheered at their unexpected arrival. The procession made its way to Starry Sept where a somber funeral rite was taking place for Archmaester Goodwyn under the watchful eyes of Lord Donnel Hightower and Lady Elissa Farman. As Jaehaerys and the High Septon entered, they bowed their heads in respect before walking up to deliver a heart-wrenching eulogy that brought tears to all who were present. Before long it became clear that Queen Jaehaerys had no intention on leaving Oldtown anytime soon as she asked her Kingsguard to remain while they completed the Funeral rites in peace. Despite her sadness amid this tragic event, every time she nodded or gave an encouraging smile to those around her one could not help but feel huge sense of admiration for such character strength.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: During their time in Oldtown, Jaehaerys and Alysanne slept in Lord Donnel’s own apartments at the top of the Hightower, with all of Oldtown spread out below. We have no certain knowledge of what words passed between them and their host, for their discussions took place behind closed doors without even a maester present. Years later, however, King Jaehaerys told Septon Barth all that occurred, and Barth set down a summary for the sake of history.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Jaehaerys and Alysanne, having arrived in Oldtown just prior to the funeral rites at the Starry Sept, had nodded their approval as His High Holiness gave his eulogy. The huge crowd that had gathered cheered as they passed by the Archmaester Goodwyn into the waiting carriage. Now on their way to Lord Donnel’s Hightower, Queen Alysanne chatted away about recent events whilst Jaehaerys slept soundly. As night passed without incident and morning came all too soon for them both, what had once been a peaceful bus ride turned into farce as strange occurrences began to take place within their own carriage. With curtains firmly pulled closed around them- ostensibly so others could not spy upon them- it was only the two of them in there who witnessed these peculiar happenings!

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: The Hightowers of Oldtown were an ancient family, powerful, wealthy, proud…and large.
