It had long been their custom for the younger sons, brothers, cousins, and bastards of the house to join the Faith, where many had risen high over the centuries. Lord Donnel Hightower had a younger brother, two nephews, and six cousins serving the Seven in 54 AC; the brother, one nephew, and two cousins wore the cloth-of-silver of the Most Devout. It was Lord Donnel’s desire that one of them become High Septon.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Donnel Hightower arrived in Oldtown with his Brother, Nephew and Cousins to join the ancient and powerful Hightower family. The wealthy and proud family that had resided in Oldtown for centuries owned one of the tallest towers of Westeros. Later that night, much to Donnel's surprise, he was called by a Stranger to wear a crown in front of important lords and royal council members. His King blessed him as the newly appointed Lord of High Tower who would prove himself worthy enough like all his predecessors before him.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: King Jaehaerys did not care which house His High Holiness derived from, or whether he was of low or noble birth. His only concern was that the new High Septon be an Exceptionalist. The Targaryen tradition of sibling marriage must never again be questioned by the Starry Sept. He wanted the new Father of the Faithful to make Exceptionalism an official doctrine of the Faith. And though His Grace had no objection to Lord Donnel’s brother, nor the rest of his ilk, none of them had yet spoken on the issue, so After hours of discussion, an understanding was reached, and sealed with a great feast wherein Lord Donnel praised the wisdom of the king, whilst making him acquainted with his brothers, uncles, nephews, nieces, and cousins. Across the city at the Starry Sept, the Most Devout convened to choose their new shepherd, with agents of Lord Hightower and the king amongst them, unbeknownst to most. Four ballots were required. Septon Mattheus led on the first, as anticipated, but lacked the votes necessary to secure the crystal crown. Thereafter his numbers dwindled on every ballot, whilst other men rose up.
events: sibling marriage must never again be questioned by the Starry Sept
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: King Jaehaerys and his lords had gathered in the Starry Sept, just outside Oldtown to celebrate a grand feast. In attendance was His High Holiness, Lord Donnel and his four siblings, as well as Lord Hightower and Septon Mattheus. The occasion was to show that a sibling marriage must never again be questioned by the Starry Sept - something which reached far beyond their noble family’s low beginnings but praised them for the exceptionalist lineage they derived from the kings of Westeros; many were impressed with their power, wealth, and pride. Queen Alyssa Royce also attended, alongside her Kingsguard entourage including Maester Culiper to reach an agreement that all four ballots were unanimously required.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: On the fourth ballot, the Most Devout broke tradition, choosing a man who was not one of their own number. The laurel fell to the Septon Alfyn, who had crossed the Reach a dozen times in his litter on behalf of Jaehaerys and his queen. The Seven Kingdoms had no fiercer champion of Exceptionalism than Alfyn, but he was the oldest of the Seven Speakers, and legless besides; it seemed likely the Stranger would seek him out sooner rather than later. When that befell, his own successor would be a Hightower, the king assured Lord Donnel, provided his kin aligned themselves firmly with the Exceptionalists during Septon Alfyn’s reign.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003:
Alfyn had been standing with Lord Donnel and the rest of King Jaehaerys’s court when the fourth ballot was cast - a tie-breaker between his grace's queen, and a mysterious Stranger. Just as Alfyn feared, the result broke in favour of the Stranger. This fell like an axe amongst them all; it seemed their efforts to somehow reach a more aligned decision on that sibling marriage had proved futile. The situation then grew fiercer still as an oldest cousin of Donnel's spoke out against this new outcome. No sooner had he done so than a voice rose from amongst those gathered at Starry Sept: "Exceptionalist!" And thus ended the Great feast, from which nothing much was derived but some low noble pride. 

As Lord Donnel made his way back to Reach for another night under its dim stars, he took Alfyn along with him and told him about Queen Alysanne Velaeyon, his king's grandmother who once defined rights for star-crossed lovers everywhere –the youngest Targaryen Queen ascending to power long ago on Dragonstone, who strived harder but ruled no sooner than her father Maegor or her brother Aegon . He further praised her virtues, detailing how she led a conclave into Westeros' highborn halls in defiance of all those dragons and lords around her--a Fire blooded Pheonix crowned by might henceforth reigning fire over Westeros' lands far and wide..Together they thought upon these strings that bound one faction to another through such exceptional thoughts--but above all~those shared journeys & tales set inside each collective heart that make us stand firmer together yet dream higher & wider apart.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Thus was the bargain struck, if Septon Barth’s account can be believed. Barth himself did not question it, though he rued the corruption that made the Most Devout so easy to manipulate. “It would be better if the Seven themselves would choose their Voice on earth, but when the gods are silent, lords and kings will make themselves heard,” he wrote, and added that both Alfyn and Lord Donnel’s brother, who succeeded him, were more worthy of the crystal crown than Septon Mattheus could ever have been.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Septon Barth knew the bargain he had struck with Lord Donnel's brother was fraught with danger and corruption, but he believed in Alfyn and the quest he had been peddled. As they questioned why Ruded wanted them to succeed, the Septon wrote down his thoughts and hopes on a parchment while standing silently in agreement. During these times of turmoil, it was easy to take sides - some chose righteousness while others chose power. It would be up to Alfyn whether or not this noble journey was worthy of his time.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: No one was more astonished by the selection of Septon Alfyn than Septon Alfyn himself, who was at Ashford when word reached him. Traveling by litter, it took him more than a fortnight to reach Oldtown. Whilst awaiting his coming, Jaehaerys used the time to call at Bandallon, Three Towers, Uplands, and Honeyholt. He even flew Vermithor to the Arbor, where he sampled some of that island’s choicest wines. Queen Alysanne remained in Oldtown. The silent sisters hosted her in their motherhouse for a day of prayer and contemplation. Another day she spent with the septas who cared for the city’s sick and destitute. Amongst the novices she met was her niece Rhaella, whom Her Grace pronounced a learned and devout young woman “though much given to stammers and blushes.” For three days she lost herself in the Citadel’s great library, emerging only to attend lectures on the Valyrian dragon wars, leechcraft, and the gods of the Summer Isles.
events: Praying at motherhouse in Silent Sisters
Novices meeting with Queen Alysanne in Citadel
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Septon Alfyn was astonished when Jaehaerys and Vermithor flew up to the sky. After reaching for him, they traveled by litter to Oldtown, visiting Bandallon, Three Towers, Uplands and Honeyholt. Along the way they encountered Prudence Celtigar who had come seeking Lord Velaryon's favors in Ashford; Ser Myles Smallwood which led a party of Kingsguard knights on Patrol near Stone Drum; Ser Merrell Bullock and Ser Joffrey Doggett at Dragonstone Castle fighting off attackers and her brother Rogar Baratheon allied with Lyman Lannister at Cassella Staunton's behest. Everywhere they went people stopped what they were doing just to marvel at Queen Alysanne riding on Vermithor's back with Rhaella seated beside her. When finally reached The Arbor, Septon Alfyn prayed solemnly alongside novices in their motherhouse before joining His High Holiness to meet Queen Alysanne in Citadel where she conversed about devout beliefs that made lords of council questioned if it is possible for corruption to be rooted out so easily into silent worshipers yet worthy of recognition by all kings.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Afterward she feasted the assembled archmaesters in their own dining hall, and even presumed to lecture them. “If I had not become queen, I might have liked to be a maester,” she told the Conclave. “I read, I write, I think, I am not afraid of ravens…or a bit of blood. There are other highborn girls who feel the same. Why not admit them to your Citadel? If they cannot keep up, send them home, the way you send home boys who are not clever enough. If you would give the girls a chance, you might be surprised by how many forge a chain.” The archmaesters, loath to gainsay the queen, smiled at her words and bobbed their heads and assured Her Grace that they would consider her proposal.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: The Queen and her Conclave of archmaesters had assembled in the Citadel's dining hall, feasting on a sumptuous feast while the most learned lectured those present on how to read, write and think. The Highborn youths not afraid of ravens were sent home; instead there was an effort to give girls a chance to learn. As they ate and discussed their passions, Queen Alysanne took her leave, commending them for their devotion before she left.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Once the new High Septon reached Oldtown, stood his vigil in the Starry Sept, and had been duly anointed and consecrated to the Seven, forsaking his earthly name and all earthly ties, he blessed King Jaehaerys and Queen Alysanne at a solemn public ceremony. The Kingsguard and a company of retainers had joined the king and queen as well by that point, so His Grace decided to return by way of the Dornish Marches and the stormlands. Visits at Horn Hill, Nightsong, and Blackhaven followed.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: The High Septon has returned to Oldtown, joined by King Jaehaerys, Queen Alysanne and the Kingsguard. The party had followed a new course following the public ceremony duely anointed and consecrated in Starry Sept at the foot of Dornish Marches. Along their journey, they made stops in Stormlands, Horn Hill, Nightsong and Blackhaven where Benifer accompanied them along with Septa Maryam and her. Lord Velaryon and Ser Myles Smallwood were also part of the entourage whereas Lady Prudence Celtigar was left behind due to health concerns. When the court finally made it back to Oldtown, the Conclave assembled for a lecture in Citadel's dining hall as feasted upon fine foods; not afraid of ravens from Dragonstone who wanted to send home boys whilst give girls a chance as highborn women!

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Queen Alysanne found the last especially congenial. Though his castle was small and modest compared to the great halls of the realm, Lord Dondarrion was a splendid host and his son Simon played the high harp as well as he jousted, and entertained the royal couple by night with sad songs of star-crossed lovers and the fall of kings. So taken with him was the queen that the party lingered longer at Blackhaven than they had intended. They were still there when a raven reached them from Storm’s End with dire tidings; their mother, Queen Alyssa, was at the point of death.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Alysanne and Lord Dondarrion found themselves in the small and Modest town of Blackhaven, where they were welcomed as splendid hosts by Simon, a local lord. After having entertained them with song and story, they lingered for an especially congenial evening during which stories of star-crossed lovers between kings and qyeens had played out. As they returned to Storm's End, neither could know that the tales recounted that night would soon be echoed within their own lives; many moons later when Queen Alyssa took power it seemed that fate was inevitable long already had been chosen.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Once more Vermithor and Silverwing took to the skies, to bring the king and queen to their mother’s side as quickly as possible. The remainder of the royal party would follow overland by way of Stonehelm, Crow’s Nest, and Griffin’s Roost, under the command of Ser Gyles Morrigen, Lord Commander of the Kingsguard.
events: Bring the king and queen to their mother's side
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Vermithor and Silverwing wasted no time in taking to the skies, following their Lord Commander's charge of bringing the king and queen to their mother's side. Soon they were soaring over Stonehelm, Crow's Nest, and Griffin's Roost, cheered on by villagers who spotted the magnificent beasts in flight. As they descended closer to Stonehelm, Ser Gyles Morrigen could make out the great castle where Queen Alysanne had made her home until recently. The sight of it brought joy to his heart - a reminder that he was now on a mission from his king and queen - but also stirred within him unsettling images of Lady Alayne Royce and Queen Alyssa Baratheon conversing at court before war had engulfed this part of Westeros.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: The great Baratheon stronghold of Storm’s End has but a single tower, the massive drum tower raised by Durran Godsgrief during the Age of Heroes to stand against the wroth of the storm god. At the top of that tower, beneath only the maester’s cell and the rookery, Alysanne and Jaehaerys found their mother asleep in a bed that stank of urine, drenched in sweat and gaunt as a crone, save for her swollen belly. A maester, a midwife, and three bedmaids were in attendance on her, each grimmer than the last. Jaehaerys discovered Lord Rogar seated outside the chamber door, drunk and despairing. When the king demanded to know why he was not with his wife, the Lord of Storm’s End growled, “The Stranger’s in that room. I can smell him.”
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Lord Baratheon and the King's men, led by Durran Godsgrief, had paused outside Storm’s End where Prince Jaehaerys Targaryen confronted his father, Rogar. Riding Silverwing, they raised their swords in him honor while demanding he stand aside so they could fulfill the late Queen Alysanne's last wish- to bring her king and queen to her side at Stonehelm. They had discovered that something great and massive was swelling inside the castle tower but there were no signs of life until a deep growl rumbled in response. Alerted to danger beyond what any of them expected, Lord Baratheon and his men quickly followed behind Vermithor as King Jaehaerys climbed upon his dragon to investigate further with Lady Alayne Royce in tow.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: A cup of wine tinged with sweetsleep was all that allowed Queen Alyssa even this brief respite, Maester Kyrie explained; Alyssa had been in agony for some hours before. “She was screaming so,” one of the servants added. “Every bit o’ food we give her comes back up, and she’s having awful pain.” “She was not due,” Queen Alysanne said, in tears. “Not yet.” “Not for a moon’s turn,” confirmed the midwife. “This is no labor, m’lords. Something’s tore inside her. Babe’s dying, or will be dead soon. The mother’s too old, she’s no strength to push, and the babe’s twisted around…it’s no good. They’ll be gone by first light, both o’ them. Begging your pardons.”
adjectives: every bit o’ food we give her comes back up
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: The labor had begun, Queen Alyssa's moans tinged with moments of agony that set the midwife rushing to her side in solace. Maester Kyrie allowed for a brief pause as he explained what was happening. "Alysanne is strong," he added to confirm his earlier assumption and inspection; it seemed the child within was indeed fighting to come out, but the near-royal flesh of its mother's womb lay torn and dying - every bit o'due being brought up simply adding insult to already profound injury. Rhaena's brother growled silently in agreement among the Kingsguard surrounding them, silencing any further argument as all eyes returned to their queen as she continued her brief yet prolonged agony before screaming one last time fearfully into understanding before fading away.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Maester Kyrie did not disagree. Milk of the poppy would relieve the queen’s pain, he said, and he had a strong draught prepared…but it could kill Her Grace as easily as help her, and would almost certainly kill the child inside her. When Jaehaerys asked what could be done, the maester said, “For the queen? Nothing. She is beyond my power to save. There is a chance, a slight chance, that I could save the child. To do so I would need to cut the mother open and remove the child from her womb. The babe might live, or not. The woman will die.”
events: remove the child from her womb
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Maester Kyrie argued vehemently with the Queen that removing the child from her womb would save her life and possibly even the baby's. But Alyssa was inconsolable and wept, refusing to allow them to perform such a harrowing act. As Septa Maryam took Alysanne away for some comfort, she asked Lord Velaryon of her Kingsguard if they should go against the wishes of their Queen, to which he replied: "Yes, my Lady. We must take steps to relieve Her Grace of this burden so that we may both save her from death and kill what is certain to be a dying babe". With solemn finality Ser Myles Smallwood echoed his fellow knight’s words in agreement as Prudence Celtigar too nodded in accord but added a concrete note: "They must cut it out now or risk losing our Queen- no one is allowed a longer agony than necessary".

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: His words set Queen Alysanne to weeping. The king said only, “The woman is my mother, and a queen,” in a heavy tone. He stepped outside again, pulled Rogar Baratheon to his feet, and dragged him back into the birthing chamber, where he bade the maester repeat what he had just said. “She is your wife,” King Jaehaerys reminded Lord Rogar. “It is for you to say the words.”
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Alysanne wept silently in the Birthing Chamber and King Jaehaerys ran to her side. Lord Rogar reminded him of Maester Kyrie's instruction to remove the child from her womb, but Jaehaerys disagreed vehemently, feeling he must save the child, no matter what cost. However, his reluctance was quickly balanced out as he pulled and dragged himself away from her bedside due to heavy pounding on their chamber door by an unknown assailant that kept yelling "you will never save them!". Hearing these repeated threats caused disbelief in Queen Alysanne who shouted angrily at Jaehaerys to protect their unborn son, a plea which went unanswered as Jaehaerys reluctantly made his way towards the ever pounding door behind him.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Lord Rogar, we are told, could not bear to look upon his wife. Nor could he find the words until the king took him roughly by the arm and shook him. “Save my son,” Rogar told the maester. Then he wrenched free and fled the room again. Maester Kyrie bowed his head and sent for his blades.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Lord Rogar bellowed a desperate plea to the King and Maester Kyrie, “Save my son!” His cries echoed off the cold stone walls of the Birthing Chamber. The king shook his head in disbelief, while Kyrie took Lord Rogar roughly by the arm and said they must bear all haste to find help. As Lord Rogar wrenched free of Kyrie' grip and got ready to flee, another knight from Kingsguard dashed in with news of an attack on Dragonstone by Starkshire's army led by Benifer. Queen Alysanne wept as she bade them remember that everyone is here for one common cause - to save her nephew and ward -King Jaehaerys- from peril. With heavy hearts, both men fled and sent word throughout Seven Kingdoms for aid from Daenerys Targaryen and her three dragons – Vhagar, Dreamfyre, Silverwing.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: In many of the accounts that have come down to us, we are told that Queen Alyssa woke from her sleep before the maester could begin. Though wracked by pain and violent convulsions, she cried tears of joy to see her children there. When Alysanne told her what was about to happen, Alyssa gave her assent. “Save my babe,” she whispered. “I will go to see my boys again. The Crone will light my way.” It is pleasant to believe these were the queen’s last words. Sad to say, other accounts tell us that Her Grace died without waking when Maester Kyrie opened her belly. On one point all agree: Alysanne held her mother’s hand in her own from start to finish, until the babe’s first squall filled the room.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Alyssa woke with a start as she heard the midwife’s cry that signalled the opening of her belly. Tears immediately streamed down her face, both in grief and joy. She cried out for Maester Kyrie to be called and in his presence assented to the saving of her infant daughter, Alysanne. Her Kingsguard quickly took up arms to accompany the Maester on his journey to find Lord Rogar, Rhaena’s brother who had fled with Alysanne during a violent attack. Prudence Celtigar had offered one of her ships from Gulltown so that they may make haste across the Narrow Sea and return quickly to Dragonstone with Alysanne before any more harm could reach her. The queen's last order was for all throughout Westeros -- from Oldtown in the South to Bear Island in the North --to join in a search for her beloved daughter so that she would be safe once more beneath the Great Hall of Dragonstone, sheltered from harm by many loyal knights like Ser Garon Swann and Ser Myles Smallwood who rode at a breakneck pace into an uncertain future carrying only hope within their hearts

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Lord Rogar did not get the second son that he had prayed for. The child was a girl, born so small and weak that midwife and maester alike did not believe she would survive. She surprised them both, as she would surprise many others in her time. Days later, when he had finally recovered himself enough to consider the matter, Rogar Baratheon named his daughter Jocelyn.
events: the child was a girl born so small and weak that midwife and maester alike did not believe she would survive
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Lord Rogar had been desperate for a son, so when Queen Alyssa opened her belly and he heard they'd birthed only the second son of twins, a quiet sadness had filled him. But this soon gave way to joyous amazement upon realizing that the child was actually a girl born so small and weak that midwife and maester alike did not believe she would survive. He quickly got down on his knees and prayed to the gods for her survival before naming her Jocelyn in thanks for being granted such a small but powerful blessing. In years to come, many would come to know of Lord Rogar's love for Jocelyn - from prisoners across the lands coming into King's Landing writining madly of his daughter's beauty as they were wracked by violent pleasure during their stay at Maegor Towers, to star-crossed lovers whispering in awe as he watched Uncle Donnel name Alysanne Targaryen his own ward despite objections put forth by many. Though Lord Rogar was considered one of most powerful men in Westeros, it was perhaps his smallest gift for which he was most remembered: his love for tiny Jocelyn who still held his heart long after she left this world.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: First, however, his lordship had to contend with a more contentious arrival. Dawn was breaking and Queen Alyssa’s body was not yet cold when Vermithor raised his head from where he had been coiled sleeping in the yard, and gave out with a roar that woke half of Storm’s End. He had scented the approach of another dragon. Moments later Dreamfyre descended, silver crests flashing along her back as her pale blue wings beat against the red dawn sky. Rhaena Targaryen had come to make amends to her mother.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Alyssa arrived at Storm's End with her dragon, Vermithor, hotly contended and eagerly awaited. The arrival of the heir to the Iron Throne descended upon the castle like a sweet scented wind on a summer night arousing sentiments of joy but also contentions on who would be raised in the shadow of kingship should Rhaena Targaryen prove too small and weak, much like his second son when Jocelyn first had tales there was a girl so small she barely survived past infancy. Most around her prayed that it would not be so and gave thanks when they named a healthy baby "Rhaena" but all knew that if Queen Alyssa did not soon contend for whom she wanted to raise, Lord Rogar might raise Rhaena with his silver-tongue swordsmanship and pale blue family banner behind him.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: She came too late; Queen Alyssa was gone. Though the king told her she did not need to look upon their mother’s mortal remains, Rhaena insisted, ripping away the bedclothes that covered her to gaze upon the maester’s work. After a long time she turned away to kiss her brother on the cheek and embrace her younger sister. The two queens held each other for a long while, it is said, but when the midwife offered Rhaena the newborn babe to hold, she refused. “Where is Rogar?” she asked.
events: coming too late to find Queen Alissa gone
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Alyssa, Rhaena and her brother had just descended upon Storm's End when they came to find the Queen gone. The maester insisted that they should hurry onward but Rhaena refused the suggestion. Despite their contentious situation in which the king's silver-pale blue gaze was held by all, Rhaena asked of every possible place that she might be coming too late or if anyone had seen her insists on going anyway as did her brother and midwife. Finally they found one man named Rogar who shook his head and said longingly "Perhaps we were too late." Exasperated, the group moved on until no stone was left unturned in their search for Queen Alissa.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: She found him below in his great hall with his young son, Boremund, in his lap, surrounded by his brothers and his knights. Rhaena Targaryen pushed through all of them to stand over him, and began to curse him to his face. “Her blood is on your hands,” she raged at him. “Her blood is on your cock. May you die screaming.”
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: She found herself in the Great Hall, pushed through a crowd of knights and courtiers, curse words on her lips she could barely restrain. Her rage at Him that had left her sister to suffer alone filled her with such anger, the air around them felt like it crackled with energy. Boremund was there too, insistent Rhaena Targaryen not be blamed if something happened to Queen Alyssa while they were all away. They both held a gaze on each other - refusing to break before one asked. After what felt like a long eternity without anyone speaking, he stepped aside and let Rhaena pass.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Rogar Baratheon was outraged by her accusations. “What are you saying, woman? This is the will of the gods. The Stranger comes for all of us. How could it be my doing? What did I do?”
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Rogar Baratheon's voice echoed through the Great Hall as he became increasingly outraged. He accused those present of treachery and cursed them in a tone that betrayed his fury. Boremund, Rhaena Targaryen’s brother, leapt to his feet and shouted an answer at Rogar while Knighst put their hands on the hilts of their swords ready to act if need be. As the tension mounted, Lord Velaryon remembered stories of the star-crossed lovers Alys Westhill and Wat the Hewer back in Dragonstone who had recently married despite everyone seeking to keep them apart, giving him hope for a peaceful resolution.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: “You put your cock in her. She gave you one son, that should have been enough. Save my wife, you should have said, but what are wives to men like you?” Rhaena reached out and grabbed his beard and pulled his face to hers. “Hear this, my lord. Do not think to wed again. Take care of the whelps my mother gave you, my half-brother and half- sister. See that they want for nothing. Do that, and I will let you be. If I should hear even a whisper of your taking some other poor maid to wife, I will make another Harrenhal of Storm’s End, with you and her inside it.”
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Rhaena watched in shock as her Lord, Rogar Baratheon, rode away from Harrenhal towards Storm's End. He had been outraged by the accusations made against him and was determined to save his name. Rhaena longed for what they could have had together and wished he would turn around and wed her already. Despite his departure she knew he wanted her to want for nothing and that he would always take care of her; no matter the circumstances. However, she remained poor without him, yet still eager to hear about all of their adventures together— a true star-crossed couple indeed.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: When she had stormed from the hall, back to her dragon in the yard, Lord Rogar and his brothers shared a laugh. “She is mad,” he declared. “Does she think to frighten me? Me? I did not fear the wroth of Maegor the Cruel, should I fear hers?” Thereafter he drank a cup of wine, summoned his steward to make arrangements for his wife’s burial, and sent his brother Ser Garon to invite the king and queen to stay on for a feast in honor of his daughter.*
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Lord Rogar stormed from the hall and in the yard, he drank a cup of wine. He terrified everyone around him with his mad anger as he summoned his steward and invoked upon him to invite King Maegor the Cruel and Queen Visenya to Harrenhal. Ser Garon had all intentions to save Rhaena whom his lord intended to wed, so she would want for nothing and they could make her hear dreams that no poor soul should suffer.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: It was a sadder king who returned to King’s Landing from Storm’s End. The Most Devout had given him the High Septon he desired, the Doctrine of Exceptionalism would be a tenet of the Faith, and he had reached an accord with the powerful Hightowers of Oldtown, but these victories had turned to ashes in his mouth with the death of his mother. Jaehaerys was not one to brood, however; as he would do so often during his long reign, the king shrugged off his sorrows and plunged himself into the ruling of his realm.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Jaehaerys and his mother, Queen Alyssa, had just returned from Oldtown after a long and wearisome voyage. As they reached King's Landing, the relieved people of the land were soon filled with joy at given the recent political unrest plaguing the realm. The mood lightened even more when it was given that Storm's End would be open for Jaerhaerys to visit. Soon after their arrival, Jaehaerys called for a grand feast in which he invited all lords and ladies of Westeros to gather at the capital city and honor him as true ruler of Seven Kingdoms. As they all reached there, Jaehaerys plunged himself into this newfound power iffering him realizing how devoted his people were to their cause but also feeling much sadder with each passing day by knowing how powerful his enemies could become in no time without any warning sign or prophecy. It seemed as if nothing would ever drive away this fear planted deep within his heart but nevertheless Jaehaerys desired to make good use of whatever he had been given so far.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Summer had given way to autumn and leaves were falling all across the Seven Kingdoms, a new Vulture King had emerged in the Red Mountains, the sweating sickness had broken out on the Three Sisters, and Tyrosh and Lys were edging toward a war that would almost certainly engulf the Stepstones and disrupt trade. All this must needs be dealt with, and deal with it he did.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Jaehaerys had returned to King's Landing with his mother, but he was far from the powerful figure he had desired to become. His dreams of grandeur had plunged him into a sadder state as he sought solace in the devotion of The Vulture King and his Three Sisters on the other side of Seven Kingdoms beside the Red Mountains, across from the Stepstones. As autumn crept in and began to blanket Kings Landing with its falling leaves, Jaehaerys felt exhausted dealing with it all alone, sweating until Benifer - one of the Kingsguard - joined him by surprise.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Queen Alysanne found a different answer. Having lost a mother, she found solace in a daughter. Though not quite a year and a half old, Princess Daenerys had been talking (after a fashion) since well before her first nameday, and had gone past crawling, lurching, and walking into running. “She is in a great hurry, this one,” her wet nurse told the queen. The little princess was a happy child, endlessly curious and utterly fearless, a delight to all who knew her. She so enchanted Alysanne that for a time Her Grace even began to eschew council sessions, preferring to spend her days playing with her daughter and reading her the stories that her own mother had once read to her. “She is so clever, she will be reading to me before long,” she told the king. “She is going to be a great queen, I know it.”
events: talking since well before her first nameday
verbs: preferring to spend days playing with daughter,
adjectives: delight to all who knew her,
going to be a great queen
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Alysanne had found solace in the company of her daughter, Princess Daenerys. From when she was crawling to lurching and walking and running, Daenerys had been talking since well before her first nameday, telling every story she’d heard or read with great enthusiasm – and asking endless questions that never seemed to have a different answer. It was obvious that young Daenerys was a happy child; endlessly curious, utterly fearless and a delight to all who knew her - even the Vulture King from the Seven Kingdoms along the Red Mountains felt enchanted by Alysanne’s so clever little girl going to be a great queen one day. She took pleasure in reading stories with her daughter each night or preferring to spend long days playing rather than facing what could come alone; yet still everyone at Dragonstone knew Her Grace would continue on as best they could, dealing with it ever since autumn arrived full of falling leaves- each continuing toward their fate whether joyous or sorrowful alike.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: The Stranger was not yet done with House Targaryen in that cruel year of 54 AC, however. Across Blackwater Bay on Dragonstone, Rhaena Targaryen had found new griefs awaiting her when she returned from Storm’s End. Far from being a joy and a comfort to her as Daenerys was to Alysanne, her own daughter Aerea had become a terror, a willful wild child who defied her septa, her mother, and her maesters alike, abused her servants, absented herself from prayers, lessons, and meals without leave, and addressed the men and women of Rhaena’s court with such charming names as “Ser Stupid,” “Lord Pigface,” and “Lady Farts-a-Lot.”
verbs: absented herself from prayers, lessons and meals without leave
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: The Stranger had heard stories about the wilful wild child of House Targaryen before arriving at Dragonstone. Little Aerea, daughter of Rhaena Targaryen and Princess Dany's cousin defied those around her, abused those below her rank and absented herself from prayers, lessons and meals without leave. He could hardly believe his eyes when he saw the same smirk on Alysanne’s face as she spun tales before His Grace King Jaehaerys just one week after finding new griefs awaiting her in Blackwater Bay . When asked to retreat, it was Daenerys who stepped forward with a different answer; finally standing up for an impish girl who seemed more eager to spend days playing than royal duties - much like the queen remembered crawling, lurching walking then running right next to a young Queen Alysanne told tales and read stories all day long for months at Storm's End before her own mother's passing was lamented  - taught by their happy child, who happily shouldered any task she had been set with utter fearlessness proving a delight to all who knew her. The Stranger smiled as he watched Her Grace’s enchanted magical powers captivate even wild spiritedAlys , so clever that most believed she was truly going to be a great queen someday soon.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Her Grace’s husband, Androw Farman, though less vocal and openly defiant, was no less angry. When word first reached Dragonstone that Queen Alyssa was failing, Androw had announced that he would accompany his wife to Storm’s End. As her husband, he said, his place was at Rhaena’s side, to give her comfort. The queen had refused him, however, and not gently. A loud argument had preceded her departure, and Her Grace was heard to say, “The wrong Farman ran away.” Her marriage, never passionate, had become a mummer’s farce by 54 AC. “And not an entertaining one,” Lady Alayne Royce observed.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Androw Farman, the only son of Lady Elissa Farman and a distant cousin to Queen Alyssa, had been enlisted in House Targaryen's court during Queen Alyssa's failing health. Rhaena immediately resent Androw for his presence and refused to accompany him out on various tasks. After several failed attempts of trying to gain her trust, he ran away from Dragonstone and became a vocal support for the exiled Houses who had openly defied Queen Alyssa. His passionate speeches inspired some who felt as though their anger was appropriately expressed; however Rhaena remained unconvinced and her Grace would not allow one as openly defiant as Androw near Storm’s End which prompted an uncharacteristically angry reaction from the Wilful Wild Child.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Androw Farman was no longer the lad that Rhaena had married five years earlier on Fair Isle, when he was ten-and-seven. The comely stripling had become puffy-faced, round-shouldered, and fleshy. Never well regarded by other men, he had found himself forgotten and ignored by their lordly hosts during Rhaena’s wanderings in the west. Dragonstone proved to be no better. His wife was still a queen, but no one mistook Androw for a king, or even a lord consort. Though he sat at Queen Rhaena’s side during meals, he did not share her bed. That honor went to her friends and favorites. His own bedchamber was in an altogether different tower from hers. The gossips at court said the queen told him that it was better that they slept apart, so he need not be disturbed if he should find some pretty maid to warm his bed. There is no indication that he ever did.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Androw Farman and Rhaena had married on the small island of Fair Isle, located off Dragonstone. Both were forgotten, ignored and not spoken of any longer by Queen Alyssa or Her Grace. They sat at opposite ends of their table when they ate together, shared no words at all when in their bed chambers at night and nobody knew that they ever slept in the same room. Being unattached did not suit Androw either as he was comely, puffy-faced and round-shouldered with a certain fleshy lordliness about him that made his appearance better than most others. His beautiful wife however, Rhaena was far prettier than her husband and many whispered behind closed curtains that she could have easily chosen someone better then Androw – if only she had been allowed to do so.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: His days were as empty as his nights. Though he had been born upon an island and now lived upon another, Androw did not sail or swim or fish. A failed squire, he had no skill with sword nor axe nor spear, so when the men of the castle garrison trained each morning in the yard, he kept to his bed. Thinking that he might be of a bookish disposition, Maester Culiper tried to interest him in the treasures of Dragonstone’s library, the ponderous tomes and Old Valyrian scrolls that had fascinated King Jaehaerys, only to discover that the queen’s husband could not read. Androw rode passably well, and from time to time would have a horse saddled so he might trot about the yard, but he never passed beyond the gates to explore the Dragonmont’s rocky paths or the far side of the island, nor even the fishing village and docks beneath the castle.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Androw sailed away from Fair Isle, content with his new life as husband to Rhaena. He soon found himself on an island far from Dragonstone and the castle library where he had taken such interest in reading during his time there. Together with Maester Culiper, he swam, fished and trained for battle - all empty activities that filled the hours until King Jaehaerys decided it was time for Androw to make something of himself. The bookish young man had grown strong and passably comely in those months by the sea, a remarkable change from when he'd first arrived - puffy-faced round-shouldered, and fleshy. He knew that life would only get better now that Lordly duties were calling out to him.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: “He drinks a deal,” Maester Culiper wrote to the Citadel, “and has been known to spend entire days in the Chamber of the Painted Table, moving painted wooden soldiers about the map. Queen Rhaena’s companions are wont to say he is planning his conquest of Westeros. They do not mock him to his face for her sake, but they titter at him behind his back. The knights and men-at-arms pay him no mind whatsoever, and the servants obey him or not, as they please, with no fear of his displeasure. The children are the cruelest, as children often are, and none half so cruel as the Princess Aerea. She once emptied a chamberpot upon his head, not for anything he did, but because she was wroth with her mother.”
events: emptied a chamberpot upon his head
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: The bustling and somewhat chaotic atmosphere in the Chamber of the Painted Table was only amplified by Princess Aerea’s antics, who spent most of her time mocking Maester Culiper or staring him down with a devilish grin. Queen Rhaena barely suppressed her titter as she gazed upon her daughter's mischievousness, paying it no mind as she made plans for visiting Dragonstone on their voyage out at sea. After departing from the Citadel, Androw steered them towards an island off the coast - which provided some refreshment to its passengers. But unbeknownst to them, lurking amongst its rocky paths were two star-crossed lovers -- Vhagar and Her Grace -- whose souls had been bound together but separated by fate - just as dragon and man can never conjoin again.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Androw Farman’s discontent on Dragonstone only grew worse after his sister’s departure. Lady Elissa had been his closest friend, mayhaps his only friend, Culiper observed, and despite his tearful denials, Rhaena found it hard to accept that he had played no role in the matter of her dragon eggs. When the queen dismissed Ser Merrell Bullock, Androw had asked her to appoint him commander of the castle garrison in Bullock’s place. Her Grace had been breaking her fast with four of her ladies-in-waiting at the time. The women burst into laughter at his request, and after a moment the queen had laughed as well. When Rhaena flew to King’s Landing to inform King Jaehaerys of the theft, Androw had offered to accompany her. His wife refused him scornfully. “What would that serve? What could you possibly do but fall off the dragon?”
events: Androw offered to accompany Rhaena to King's Landing
adjectives: closest friend, mayhaps only friend, tearful denials, scornfully
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: As Queen Rhaena and the others proceeded out of the Chamber of the Painted Table, her closest friend, Lady Elissa Farman, asked to accompany them on their journey south. They all burst into laughter at her request. It was a welcome change from the cruelest mockery Maester Culiper had received earlier for emptying a chamberpot upon his head. Androw Farman observed and accepted her plea with surprising assurance, given that he was nothing more than a common thief of dragon eggs when they met in Dragonstone. The Queen dismisses Ser Merrell Bullock's offer only to ask Androw; His Grace joked at this suggestion but ultimately allowed him to accompany them to King's Landing - an act no one expected would calm the situation which only grew worse as plans were made for departure. The Princess Aerea took comfort in Androwe’s embrace with tearful denials while everyone else tittered at Her Graces command.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Queen Rhaena’s denial of his wish to go with her to Storm’s End was but the latest and the last in a long string of humiliations for Androw Farman. By the time Rhaena returned from her mother’s deathbed, he was well past any desire to comfort her. Sullen and cold, he sat silent at meals and avoided the queen’s company elsewise. If Rhaena Targaryen was troubled by his sulks, she gave little sign of it. She found consolation in her ladies instead, in old friends like Samantha Stokeworth and Alayne Royce, and newer companions like her cousin Lianna Velaryon, Lord Staunton’s pretty daughter Cassella, and young Septa Maryam.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Rhaena was in a state of denial when she returned with Androw Farman to Storm's End. She sat silently, her face drawn into a sullen and cold expression, while Samantha Stokeworth and Alayne Royce discussed the recent troubling events. All around them Lianna Velaryon and Lord Staunton exchanged old stories that seemed too distant from their newer worries; even Cassella was too busy processing what had just happened to say anything more than a few pretty words of comfort. Sitting beside them all was Septa Maryam who only grew worse as Queen Rhaena kept silent despite her denials to the contrary. Through it all, Androw helplessly observed, knowing that no matter how gracious Lady Elissa’s offer had been - his closest friend, mayhaps only friend - all he could do now is accept her departure tearful denials and scornfully laughed at requests for him to accompany her to King's Landing.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Whatever peace they helped her find proved short-lived. Autumn had come to Dragonstone, as to the rest of Westeros, and with it came cold winds from the north and storms from the south raging up the narrow sea. A darkness settled over the ancient fortress, a gloomy place even in summer; even the dragons seemed to feel the damp. And as the year waned, the sickness came to Dragonstone.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Rhaena had come to Dragonstone feeling sullen, having been denied a return to Storm's End. She had come to find an answer; however, the cold and stormy landscape of Westeros seemed gloomy and her energy waned as she came closer to her destination. The short-lived peace that had seemed so inviting when she left north of the Narrow Sea also dampened her spirits. Amidst all this trouble, a new desire arose in her heart: someplace far away from Westeros -- somewhere she could settle down, perhaps start anew where nobody knew her name or understood the old troubles that sat heavy on her shoulders?

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: It was not the sweating sickness, nor the shaking sickness, nor greyscale, Maester Culiper pronounced. The first sign was a bloody stool, followed by a terrible cramping in the gut. There were a number of diseases that could be the cause, he told the queen. Which of those might be to blame he never determined, for Culiper himself was the first to die, less than two days after he began to feel ill. Maester Anselm, who took his place, thought his age to blame. Culiper had been closer to ninety than to eighty, and not strong.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Maester Culiper, after much deliberation and study of the Sweating Sickness and the Shaking sickness that had been wreaked havoc on Westeros from North to South and beyond the Narrow Sea, pronounced his determination that a terrible sort of bloody magic was at play and upon seeing Maester Anselm's affirmation, The Queen strongly agreed. Despite diverging opinions amongst some Lords in Dragonstone as to who or what could be blamed for these terrible afflictions, it seemed all suspected there was strong supernatural forces at hand – a suspicion that unfortunately only grew stronger with the passing days.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Cassella Staunton was the next to succumb, however, and she was but four-and-ten. Then Septa Maryam sickened, and Alayne Royce, and even big, boisterous Sam Stokeworth, who liked to boast that she had never been sick a day in her life. All three died the same night, within hours of one another.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Cassella Staunton, Septa Maryam and Alayne Royce had been boastful of how they were able to read the signs of the two sicknesses that had caused Maester Culiper to pronounce terrible diagnoses. The Queen was determined not to blame them for this terror and instead assumed it must be a more powerful force at work. But when Cassella Staunton, Septa Maryam and her four-and-ten others succumbed to a new, more bloody variety of shaking sickness after Sam Stokeworth yelled out "boisterous frivolities," strong in his belief that he'd been impervious its grasp - they all knew then just how wrong they had been.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Rhaena Targaryen herself remained untouched, though her friends and dear companions were being felled one by one. It was her Valyrian blood that saved her, Maester Anselm suggested; ailments that carried off ordinary men in a matter of hours could not prevail against the blood of the dragon. Males also seemed largely immune to this queer plague. Aside from Maester Culiper, only women were struck down. The men of Dragonstone, be they knights, scullions, stableboys, or singers, remained healthy.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: When Rhaena Targaryen arrived at Dragonstone, she was saved by Maester Anselm and Culiper. Lord Rego Draz commended her courage and said that Rhaena had “felled beasts bigger than any boast made in the four-and-ten of King’s Landing”. Though Alayne Royce and Cassella Staunton had succumbed to the same sickness that befell Septa Maryam, Rhaena had prevailed due to her own strength and will. She set about to bring Dragonstone back to its former glory but no matter how much she changed it, one thing remained unchanged - her love for Sam Stokeworth, whom she still held dear despite his illness. However, despite his weak physical state, he seemed inexplicably healthy in a way only divine intervention could explain.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Queen Rhaena ordered the gates of Dragonstone closed and barred. As yet there was no sickness beyond her walls, and she meant for it to stay that way, to protect the smallfolk. When she sent word to King’s Landing, Jaehaerys acted at once, commanding Lord Velaryon to send forth his galleys to make certain no one escaped to spread the pestilence beyond the island. The King’s Hand did as commanded, though not without grief, for his own young niece was amongst the women still on Dragonstone.
events: Queen Rhaena ordering the gates of Dragonstone closed and barred
Lord Velaryon sending forth his galleys to make certain no one escaped to spread the pestilence beyond the island
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Rhaena commanded Lord Velaryon to send forth his galleys so that no one could escape Dragonstone and spread the disease beyond the island. The order was meant to act in the best of interests for all, but it did not make the bereaved smallfolk at Dragonstone any less grief-stricken. Even Lady Alayne Royce, Rhaena's dear friend and Queen Alyssa's younger sister, was shaken by the news that their beloved island had been afflicted by this pestilence. Nevertheless, her hope in Queen Rhaena remained unchanged -- together they would prevail against this hardship as they had done before.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Lianna Velaryon died even as her uncle’s galleys were pushing off from Driftmark. Maester Anselm had purged her, bled her, and covered her with ice, all to no avail. She died in Rhaena Targaryen’s arms, convulsing as the queen wept bitter tears.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Rhaena Targaryen wept bitterly as Lianna Velaryon, her beloved younger sister, died in Maester Anselm's arms at their ancestral home of Driftmark. She had seen death more times that she cared to remember - from distant relatives to the smallfolk who had suffered during the pestilence - but nothing compared to the grief of losing a family member so close to her. To purge her sorrows and stop them from overtaking her completely, Rhaena commanded her Kingsguard and Lady Alayne Royce over an arduous journey across Westeros with Lord Myles Smallwood then south over seas to Pentos; a place they knew they'd find solace and possibly answers. From King's Landing all the way up past Red Mountains onto Maidenpool and back again; Rhaena acted wth a mix of grief and desperation never seen nor heard before by those travelling with her.  When they finally returned back to Dragonstone, affected by what she had looked upon on this quest for clarity, peace or justice seemed almost imminent given how far everyone had come in covering this entire journey.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: “You weep for her,” Androw Farman said when he saw the tears on his wife’s face, “but would you weep for me?” His words woke a fury in the queen. Lashing him across the face, Rhaena commanded him to leave her, declaring that she wanted to be alone. “You shall be,” Androw said. “She was the last of them.”
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Androw Farman was a devoted friend of Rhaena Targaryen and no one in Driftmark saw him weep for her more than anyone else did. Despite the bitter tears that were shed that day, he managed to remain strong when commanded by Lady Elissa Farman to leave. He wanted so much more time before she passed on but shall be forever grateful for the time they had shared together on his last visit at Dragonstone. As he silently wept, the King's Guards lashing him across the face - with all of Ser Myles Smallwood, Lord Velaryon, Lady Prudence Celtigar and Septa Ysabel's knowledge - awakened something inside of him as if Queen Alyssa heard his plea from beyond life itself.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Even then, so lost was the queen in her grief that she did not realize what had happened. It was Rego Draz, the king’s Pentoshi master of coin, who first gave voice to suspicion when Jaehaerys assembled his small council to discuss the deaths on Dragonstone. Reading over Maester Anselm’s accounts, Lord Rego furrowed his brow and said, “Sickness? This is no sickness. A weasel in the guts, dead in a day…this is the tears of Lys.” “Poison?” King Jaehaerys said in shock. “We know more of such things in the Free Cities,” Draz assured him. “It is the tears, never doubt it. The old maester would have seen it soon enough, so he had to die first. That is how I would do it. Not that I would. Poison is…dishonorable.” “Only women were struck down,” objected Lord Velaryon. “Only women got the poison, then,” said Rego Draz.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Rhaena and her court of Lord Velaryon, Rego Draz and Jaehaerys assembled at Dragonstone to discuss the deaths on the island. Maester Anselm gave voice to suspicion that rose in the assembly hall with furrowed brows, "My lord," he said, his face a shock of fear, "it may be that these deaths were not just an unfortunate accident but something more dishonorable." Before they could draw further conclusions, a Stranger entered the room cloaked in Scarlet - none other than Cassella Staunton from Oldtown. She relayed news of an attack on Smallwood’s stronghold by forces under Lyman Lannister's command and Alys Westhill's army marching towards Riverrun. Queen Rhaena commanded her Kingsguard to leave for The Vale while she contemplated their next move over a dish served by Septa Edyth. It seemed all too clear now that war was coming - whether it be from King Mooton across the Sunset Sea or Alaric Stark bringing unrest from The North, only time would tell who was to blame for this horror unfolding.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: When Septon Barth and Grand Maester Benifer concurred with Lord Rego’s words, the king dispatched a raven to Dragonstone. Once Rhaena Targaryen read his words, she had no doubt. Summoning the captain of her guards, she commanded that her husband be found and brought to her.
events: Summoning the captain of her guards
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Septon Barth and Grand Maester Benifer concurred when Lord Rego recommended sending a raven to Dragonstone. They were standing in the great hall of Dragonstone, trying to give voice to suspicion that had been growing since Maester Anselm had discussed the sudden deaths on the island. After Queen Rhaena Targaryen read it, she commanded her captain of her guards be brought before her. The lords of the council found him in short order, and summoned him forthwith. It was then they realized they needed someone with more cunning if they were expected to solve this strange mystery- Lady Alayne Royce was dispatched on a secret mission across the sea to seek aid from those familiar with seedy underbellies of Free Cities such as Pentos or Tyrosh. All common folk lost in shock could only furrow their brows as an air of dishonorable conduct hung thickest in these walls.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Androw Farman was not to be found in his bedchamber nor the queen’s, nor the great hall, nor the stables, nor the sept, nor Aegon’s Garden. In Sea Dragon Tower, in the maester’s chambers under the rookery, they discovered Maester Anselm dead, with a dagger between his shoulder blades. With the gates closed and barred, there was no way to leave the castle save by dragon. “My worm of a husband does not have the courage for that,” Rhaena declared.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Rhaena Targaryen was marching through the corridors of Dragonstone with her captain of her guards in tow when they came across Androw Farman, one of the castle’s maesters. The concurred that something had gone wrong and Farman brought them to Maester Anselm’s bedchamber, where they found he had been discovered dead. Rhaena commanded that word be sent immediately to the great hall, summoning all her lords and allies from across Dragonstone, including Septon Barth and Grand Maester Benifer who she knew would be able to help uncover what happened.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Androw Farman was located at last in the Chamber of the Painted Table, a longsword clutched in his grasp. He made no attempt to deny the poisonings. Instead he boasted. “I brought them cups of wine, and they drank. They thanked me, and they drank. Why not? A cupbearer, a serving man, that’s how they saw me. Androw the sweet. Androw the jape. What could I do, but fall off the dragon? Well, I could have done a lot of things. I could have been a lord. I could have made laws and been wise and given you counsel. I could have killed your enemies, as easily as I killed your friends. I could have given you children.”
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Androw Farman was welcomed into the Chamber of the Painted Table with great fanfare, and though he had come to talk of treasonous poisonings in the court, his gaze lingered on all that surrounded him. He clutched a letter in one hand as an attempt to deny any involvement, while he boasted of being brought to Justice by Ser Myles Smallwood and Lady Prudence Celtigar. Little did they know Androw drank deeply from their cup of wisdom before thanking them for it and then falling off into a long sword fight which could have done more damage than he ever killed on his own. He desperately hoped that this gift would be enough for those who had given it or else he knew things could have gone very differently. With newfound conviction coursing through his veins, Androw marched towards the Sept knowing full well what might await him up ahead in Aegon's Garden where Queen Alyssa suggested so many moons ago...

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Rhaena Targaryen did not deign to reply to him. Instead she spoke to her guards, saying, “Take him and geld him, but staunch the wound. I want his cock and balls fried up and fed to him. Do not let him die until he has eaten every bite.”
events: Do not let him die until he has eaten every bite
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Rhaena Targaryen deigned to speak from her high seat in the Chamber of the Painted Table, making a proclamation that sent shivers down Androw Farman's spine. She commanded two of the Kingsguard to take him and geld him for his attempt to deny his guilt in the series of poisonings that had taken place at Dragonstone. He had boasted he was innocent, yet he had brought aloud pitchers of sweet jape into court, drank them himself and thanked those who gave them - unaware they were poisoned.  With these words Rhaena made it clear she could have done much worse than what she did; yet she offered mercy if Lord Velaryon would staunch his wound before he fell off and be fed until every last crumb was eaten, lest he be killed as soon as he is given a longsword.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: “No,” Androw Farman said, as they moved around the Painted Table to grasp him. “My wife can fly, and so can I.” And so saying, he slashed ineffectually at the nearest man, backed to the window behind him, and leapt out. His flight was a short one: downward, to his death. Afterward Rhaena Targaryen had his body hacked to pieces and fed to her dragons.
events: hacked to pieces and fed to her dragons
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Rhaena Targaryen, standing and rallying in front of the Painted Table said to Androw Farman, "Grasp this situation. We cannot her defeat him here so take him, geld him and staunch his wound." Everyone at the table was still as Rhaena spoke. As soon as she finished speaking, Androw leapt out from his chair and flew away with their prisoner on control - determined that he would not die until he had eaten every last bit of remorse fed to him. Rhaena watched but could only do ineffectually as her brother Rogar targeted a landing spot far below where he intend to have his body hacked to pieces before feeding them to Dragonstone's dragons Lady Elissa Farman or Dreamfyre or Vhagar; all seemed apt satisfiers for a Queen's rage.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: His was the last notable death of 54 AC, but there was still more ill to come in that terrible Year of the Stranger. Just as a stone thrown into a pond will send out ripples in all directions, the evil that Androw Farman had wrought would spread across the land, touching and twisting the lives of others long after the dragons were done feasting on his blackened, smoking remains.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: The Year of the Stranger dawned amidst stories of feasting and celebration. As far away as the Seven Kingdoms, its festivities were notable if only for their terrible twist; in one kingdom Androw Farman had to spread word that his beloved Rhaena Targaryen had fled downward from the Painted Table, her body ultimately hacked to pieces and fed to her dragons. He moved around with a haunted, broken spirit thereafter until this day when many all over mourned the star-crossed lovers.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: The first ripple was felt in the king’s own small council, when Lord Daemon Velaryon announced his desire to step down as Hand of the King. Queen Alyssa, it will be recalled, had been Lord Daemon’s sister, and his young niece Lianna had been amongst the women poisoned on Dragonstone. Some have suggested that rivalry with Lord Manfryd Redwyne, who had replaced him as lord admiral, played a part in Lord Daemon’s decision, but this seems a petty aspersion to cast at a man who served so ably and so long. Let us rather take his lordship at his word and accept that his advancing age and a desire to spend his remaining days with his children and grandchildren on Driftmark were the cause of his departure.
events: stepped down as Hand of the King
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: When King Androw Farman stepped down as Hand of the King during the Year of the Stranger, great feasting and celebration spread through Dragonstone much to Lord Daemon Velaryon's appreciation. In a private council with Queen Alyssa and his daughter Lianna, he announced a proposal - "we should move our own small council from Dragonstone to Driftmark due to my advancing age." The other lords in attendance felt uneasy about such suggestion but accepted it nonetheless. It was then that Lord Manfryd Redwyne spoke up, suggesting they ought to send ships out towards Pentos instead while they still can. At this point, Queen Alyssa poisioned by her thirst for power accepteraised his plan with no hesitation; she thought aloud that if they could find allies over there perhaps they could even rule all of Westeros one day.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Jaehaerys’s first thought was to look to the other members of his council for Lord Daemon’s successor. Albin Massey, Rego Draz, and Septon Barth had all shown themselves to be men of great ability, earning the king’s trust and gratitude. None, however, seemed wholly suitable. Septon Barth was suspected of having greater loyalty to the Starry Sept than to the Iron Throne. Moreover, he was of very low birth; the great lords of the realm would never allow the son of a blacksmith to speak with the king’s voice. Lord Rego was a godless Pentoshi and an upjumped spicemonger, and his birth was, if anything, even lower than Septon Barth’s. Lord Albin, with his limp and twisted back, would strike the ignorant as somehow sinister. “They look at me and see a villain,” Massey himself told the king. “I can serve you better from the shadows.”
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003:
Jaehaerys rose from the Iron Throne and looked out at the Council. His gaze earned a few intimidated glances, but Lord Albin Massey remained unfazed. In a calm voice, he suggested they would strike down anyone who dared to oppose them, emphasizing that their power was great and those opposing them must be punished in a very low way. That sinister statement caught every councilmember off guard until King Jaehaerys announced it was time to break for long overdue rest.
The mood of the room drastically changed when Septon Barth walked in revealing an even greater force had just arrived. All of the characters on global context now found themselves aware of this menacing new figure as Jaehaerys allowed little conversation yet all seemed to understand that much more than simly rest awaited them beyond these walls.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: There could be no question of bringing back Rogar Baratheon nor any of King Maegor’s surviving Hands. Lord Tully’s term upon the council during the regency had been undistinguished. Rodrik Arryn, Lord of the Eyrie and Defender of the Vale, was a boy of ten, having come untimely into his lordship after the deaths of his uncle Lord Darnold and his sire Ser Rymond at the hands of the wildling raiders they had unwisely pursued into the Mountains of the Moon. Jaehaerys had but recently reached an understanding with Donnel Hightower, but still did not entirely trust the man, no more than he did Lyman Lannister. Bertrand Tyrell, the Lord of Highgarden, was known to be a drunkard, whose unruly bastard sons would bring disgrace down on the Crown if turned loose upon King’s Landing. Alaric Stark was best left in Winterfell; a stubborn man by all reports, stern and hard- handed and unforgiving, he would make for an uncomfortable presence at the council table. It would be unthinkable to bring an ironman to King’s Landing, of course.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Rogar Baratheon, King Maegor and Lord Tully had a regency to bring back the Iron Throne. The council was undistinguished and of very low authority, but allowed Jaehaerys to earn respect from other great houses. Rogar pursued into The Vale in order to try and stop an untimely assassination of Lord Darnold from wildling raiders who had descended from the mountains. Prudence Celtigar then asked Ser Rymond, Donnel Hightower, Lyman Lannister and Bertrand Tyrell for their aid against these attackers. Alaric Stark was one of the few survivors of this hostile attack as he fled with his loyal servants through Winterfell and Eyrie before eventually reaching Highgarden.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: With none of the great lords of the realm being found suitable, Jaehaerys next turned to their lords bannermen. It was thought desirable that the Hand be an older man, whose experience would balance the king’s youth. As the council included several learned men of bookish inclination, a warrior was wanted as well, a man blooded and tested in battle whose martial reputation would dishearten the Crown’s enemies. After a dozen names had been put forward and bandied about, the choice finally fell to Ser Myles Smallwood, Lord of Acorn Hall in the riverlands, who had fought for the king’s brother, Aegon, beneath the Gods Eye, battled Wat the Hewer at Stonebridge, and ridden with the late Lord Stokeworth to bring Harren the Red to justice during the reign of King Aenys.
events: Lord's bannermen turning to an older man
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Jaehaerys had ridden with Ser Myles Smallwood and Aegon at the vanguard of Lord Stokeworth's bannermen. They fought in the Battle of Acorn Hall, then rode swift to Stonebridge where Wat the Hewer slew Harren the Red. However King Aenys was too late - his bannermen had already turned to an older man who fulfilled their qualifications as a suitable king. As they bandied stories around great campfires beneath starry skies, Jaehaerys listened closely  to tales of experience: Aegon's blooded martiality on Vhagar, Rhaena Targaryen’s brother fighting wildling raiders deep north beyond The Wall, Lord Darnold slain by dragon fire...

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Justly famed for his courage, Lord Myles wore the scars of a dozen savage fights upon his face and body. Ser Willam the Wasp of the Kingsguard, who had served at Acorn Hall, swore there was no finer, fiercer, or more leal lord in all the Seven Kingdoms, and Prentys Tully and the redoubtable Lady Lucinda, his liege lords, had naught but praise for Smallwood as well. Thus persuaded, Jaehaerys gave his assent, a raven took wing, and within the fortnight, Lord Myles was on his way to King’s Landing.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Ser Myles Smallwood had just persuaded Lord Stokeworth to allow his bannerman Ser Willam to join the savage fights of Acorn Hall. Young Lord Jaerhaerys was fiercely against it, knowing too well that even warriors with greater experience than Willam would fall in these battles. But, Lord Myles managed to persuade them all regarding Willams' loyalty and martial proficiency. Soon, Jaehaerys accompanied them as well and they rode out their horses together. As they reached their destination, Jaehaerys saw a mix of fierce seasoned fighters alongside brave but inexperienced youth wearing Mail shirts and helms - They were lady Lucinda's leal knights - Justly famed for being some of the finer and fiercer warriors in the realm.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Queen Alysanne played no part in the selection of the King’s Hand. Whilst the king and council were deliberating, Her Grace was absent from King’s Landing, having flown Silverwing to Dragonstone to be with her sister and comfort her in her grief.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Alysanne flew into King's Landing on the back of Balerion and immediately set out to Dragonstone, comforted by the thought that perhaps with her selection of the King's Hand they could begin deliberating more justly. Just as her father Jaehaerys had been famed for his finer persuasion than fiercer fights, she was determined to wear leal counsel rather than engaging in savage battles. Lord Myles and Ser Willam rode with her in honor guard, whilst Prentys Tully and Lady Lucinda remained at Acorn Hall assenting to the Queen’s plan. As they arrived upon Dragonstone, all seemed quiet save for those star-crossed lovers Wat and Alys Westhill who exchanged their whispers within the shadows of Maegor Towers

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Rhaena Targaryen was not a woman easily comforted, however. The loss of so many of her dear friends and companions had plunged her into a black melancholy, and even the mention of Androw Farman’s name provoked her to fits of rage. Far from welcoming her sister and whatever solace she might bring, Rhaena thrice tried to send her away, even going so far as to scream at Her Grace in view of half the castle. When the queen refused to go, Rhaena retreated to her own chambers and barred the doors, emerging only to eat…and that less and less often.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Rhaena Targaryen comforted Her Grace as they plunged their grief together in the castle, her mind races with welcomings and send aways. Suddenly she screamed out in rage, barred the doors of the chamber and ate dear Alysanne's treasured heirloom raven-shaped hairpin as if it were an offering. The black mood that enveloped Rhaena was like a far distant shore, and yet too close for comfort at the same time.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Left to her own devices, Alysanne Targaryen set about restoring a modicum of order to Dragonstone. A new maester was sent for and installed, a new captain appointed to take charge of the castle garrison. The queen’s own beloved Septa Edyth arrived to assume the place of Rhaena’s much lamented Septa Maryam.
events: restoring a modicum of order to Dragonstone
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Alysanne Targaryen, determined to restore a modicum of order to Dragonstone, quickly set out setting a new maester, appointing a new captain and sending for Septa Edyth. Before she arrived though her beloved Maegor Towers were plunged into chaos by the arrival of her distant cousin from Vulture King's court, the Stranger. This enraged Rhaena Targaryen and she screamed for him to be sent away before she barred the castle doors. But after comforted by her grace Alys Westhill, Rhaena slowly accepted Alysanne as queen. With Septa Edth comes hope as everyone thought that She can assume control of Dragonstone and bring peace to it once again.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Shunned by her sister, Alysanne turned to her niece, but there too she encountered rage and rejection. “Why should I care if they’re all dead? She’ll find new ones; she always does,” Princess Aerea told the queen. When Alysanne tried to share stories of her own girlhood, and told of how Rhaena had put a dragon’s egg into her cradle and cuddled and cared for her “as if she were my mother,” Aerea said, “She never gave me an egg, she just gave me away and flew off to Fair Isle.” Alysanne’s love for her own daughter provoked the princess to anger as well. “Why should she be queen? I should be queen, not her.” It was then that Aerea broke down into tears at last, pleading with Alysanne to take her back with her to King’s Landing. “Lady Elissa said that she would take me, but she went away and forgot me. I want to come back to court, with the singers and the fools and all the lords and knights. Please take me with you.”
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Alysanne accompanied Princess Aerea and Rhaena on a journey to Fair Isle while Lady Elissa followed soon after. The journey had been filled with events Alysanne could scarcely have anticipated; she had encountered ridicule, shunned stares and shared tears like never before. With a heavy heart, she finally put the princess in the lap of Lady Elissa as they cuddled together, yet still found it difficult to give her away. As soon as Vulture King flew off into the west, Alysanne felt a wave of emotions provoked within her — she broke down in tears pleading for one more night or one last look at Aerea - until suddenly, she forgot all about them as His Grace requested her attendance at King’s Landing urgently.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: Moved by the girl’s tears, Queen Alysanne could do no more than promise to take the matter up with her mother. When Rhaena next emerged from her chambers to take a meal, however, she rejected the notion out of hand. “You have everything and I have nothing. Now you would take my daughter too. Well, you shall not have her.
