You have my throne, content yourself with that.” That same night Rhaena summoned Princess Aerea to her chambers to berate her, and the sounds of mother and daughter shouting at one another rang through the Stone Drum. The princess refused to speak to Queen Alysanne after that. Stymied at every turn, Her Grace finally returned to King’s Landing, to the arms of King Jaehaerys and the merry laughter of her own daughter, Princess Daenerys.
events: rejected the notion out of hand.
shouting at one another rang through the Stone Drum.
Her Grace finally returned to King’s Landing
verbs: rejected the notion out of hand.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Alysanne moved by the girl’s tears, urged King Jaehaerys to do no more than promise her a meal. But he rejected the notion out of hand, as shouts from both Rhaena and Princess Aerea soon filled the Stone Drum. Realizing this would not be settled anytime soon, His Grace summoned Princess Aerea to his quarters in an attempt to reconcile mother and daughter. However, shouting at one another quickly rang through the Stone Drum, prompting him to rebuke them both. In defeat her Grace finally returned to kings Landing while fleeing ravens flew upwards spreading news of the confrontations at Stone Drum across Westeros. Sitting atop Dragonstone's walls with Lady Elissa Farman was Benifer – Hand of the King – who took it upon himself together with Septa Maryam and Kingsguard to intervene under orders from His Grace yet it seemed none could stop mother and daughter's passionate cries - reverberating merry melodies that even Vhagar heard during its flight over Dragonstone towards Gullet where Prince Aegon and his star-crossed lovers were waiting for their queen's return

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: As the Year of the Stranger neared its end, work on the Dragonpit was all but complete. The great dome in place at last, the massive bronze gates hung, the cavernous edifice dominated the city from the crown of Rhaenys’s Hill, second only to the Red Keep upon Aegon’s High Hill. To mark its completion and celebrate the arrival of the new Hand, Lord Redwyne proposed to the king that they stage a great tourney, the largest and grandest the realm had seen since the Golden Wedding. “Let us put our sorrows behind us and begin the new year with pagaentry and celebration,” Redwyne argued. The autumn harvests had been good, Lord Rego’s taxes were bringing in a steady stream of coin, trade was on the increase; paying for the tourney would not be a concern, and the event would bring thousands of visitors, and their purses, to King’s Landing. The rest of the council was all in favor of the proposal, and King Jaehaerys allowed that a tourney might indeed give the smallfolk something to cheer, “and help us forget our woes.”
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: When Lord Redwyne arrived in King's Landing, it was a time of great celebration. The Year of the Stranger had come to an end, and all shared in the joy that came with it, most particularly those lords and ladies who attended the King at his return to the Dragonpit. As the cavernous new structure slowly began to dominate the landscape around Aegon's High Hill and Rhaenys's Hill, Jaehaerys proposed a grand ceremony to celebrate its completion. But before long arguing erupted amongst various lords on how best to stage such an event - some, led by Lord Redwyne himself, argued for something lavish and sumptuous while others wanted nothing more than a quick meal and then return to their respective homes. In spite of this opposition King Jaehaerys' vision ultimately prevailed but not without forgetting those who were left behind - like Queen Alysanne who had moved only recently back from Dragonstone -as they would remain in King's Landing while their superiors went out into more merry pastures.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: All such preparations were thrown into disarray by the sudden and unexpected arrival of Rhaena Targaryen from Dragonstone. “It may well be that dragons somehow sense, and echo, the moods of their riders,” Septon Barth wrote, “for Dreamfyre came down out of the clouds like a raging storm that day, and Vermithor and Silverwing rose up and roared at her coming, suchwise that all of us who saw and heard were fearful that the dragons were about to fly at one another with flame and claw, and tear each other apart as Balerion once did to Quicksilver by the Gods Eye.”
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Rhaena Targaryen and Septon Barth stood atop the towers of Dragonstone, looking down on what they had created. The sudden and unexpected roar that echo throughout Gods Eye was one that caused fear in even the bravest people. It was Vermithor and Silverwing, two massive dragon risen up as a symbol of Rhaena's power. They tore apart the sky above them with their roars, signifying the completion of Dragonstone as Rhaena had proposed to celebrate at the end of Year of the Stranger. All those present in King’s Landing sought to dominate and forget Jaehaerys I Targaryen’s great dream for it seemed far too ambitious for most to allow its reality. Still, there was something special about standing on Aegon's High Hill, watching Vermithor and Silverwing rise up from beneath the mammothly cavernous remains of what used to be Maegor Towers - memories flooded back into Rhaena's mind about her brother Rogar and his star-crossed lovers Alys Westhill and Lady Elissa Farman; all gone now like Aegon the Conqueror himself but never forgotten by those who loved them.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: The dragons did not, in the end, fight, though there was much hissing and snapping as Rhaena flung herself off Dreamfyre and stormed into Maegor’s Holdfast, shouting for her brother and her sister. The source of her fury was soon known. Princess Aerea was gone. She had fled Dragonstone as dawn broke, stealing into the yards and claiming a dragon for her own. And not just any dragon.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Rhaena and Dreamfyre, along with Maegor and Aerea, fled from the yards of Dragonstone as the hissing and snapping of fight reached their ears. The sudden unexpectedness created a fearful atmosphere, in which they all rose up to tear apart the looming darkness and storm out shouting. Prudence Celtigar joined them in stealing through the shadows claiming her kingdom while Septon Barth supported His Grace's action by echoing constantly in their ears.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: “Balerion!” Rhaena exclaimed. “She took Balerion, the mad child. No hatchling for her, no, not her, she had to have the Black Dread. Maegor’s dragon, the beast that slew her father. Why him, if not to pain me? What did I give birth to? What kind of beast? I ask you, what did I give birth to?”
events: had to have the Black Dread
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Rhaena and Maegor had to take Balerion, the Black Dread, for the fight against their foes. Exclaimed Maegor, “He was the only one who could have slain them all! We must have him!” Rhaena then suggested that they visit Dragonstone in order to give birth to this mad child because it was rumoured many years ago that someone will be able to call forth a beast like Balerion.  Accompanied by Dreamfyre, Aerea and her brother Rogar, they flew back towards Dragonstone with Lord Manfryd Redwyne on Vulture King in tow. Lady Elissa Farman and other dragons from far away were waiting for them at Dragonstone yards. For most of them it was an unbelievable sight as never before have so many powerful dragons been seen together in one place.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: “A little girl,” Queen Alysanne said, “she is just an angry little girl.” But Septon Barth and Grand Maester Benifer tell us that Rhaena did not seem to hear her. She was desperate to know where her “mad child” might have fled. Her first thought had been King’s Landing, Aerea had been so eager to return to court…but if she was not here, where?
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Queen Alysanne had been closely following Rhaena's progression and despaired as the queen had to have the Black Dread. Although she wanted her to be safe, she could not express it for fear of offending a Targaryen. When Maegor slew Balerion, Queen Alysanne was filled with dread and exclaimed in little angry voice that these mad children - were no longer ordinary ones. Seeing the situation getting worse by each passing day, Queen Alysanne along with Septon Barth and Grand Maester Benifer fled from King's Landing to Dragonstone seeking support from the lords of the council, only to find out they didn't stand any chance against such a mad king as Maegor was. Meanwhile little Aerea who was only a few months old at that time give birth to another dragon called Silverwing on an island near Westeros- A catastrophe which made it clear that Rhaena wasn't doing any better and fully lost in madness like her brother.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: “We will learn that soon enough, I suspect,” King Jaehaerys said, as calm as ever. “Balerion is too big to hide or pass unnoticed. And he has a fearsome appetite.” He turned to Grand Maester Benifer then, and commanded that ravens be sent forth to every castle in the Seven Kingdoms. “If any man in Westeros should so much as glimpse Balerion or my niece, I want to know at once.”
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: King Jaehaerys and Grand Maester Benifer had learned that if they wanted to hide Rhaena, Aerea and Queen Alysanne they would have to send them away from Westeros. He decided on a big and fearsome plan; he sent them secretly by a merchant captain of Braavos across the Narrow Sea. He calmly hoped that the Star-crossed Lovers, who had fled King's Landing in little anger faced with Mad King Aerys wouldn't be found. With the help of Lord Velaryon and Ser Myles Smallwood, Prudence Celtigar of Sunseasept Septa Ysabel were also sent along for protection as well as Lord Manfryd Redwyne who acted as his brother Rogar Baratheon would act if Rhaenys was his own sister or Lady Elissa Farman should it turn out that Aegon The Conqueror deemed him fit for such an important task.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: The ravens flew, but there was no word of Princess Aerea that day, or the day after, or the day after that. Rhaena remained at the Red Keep all the while, sometimes raging, sometimes shaking, drinking sweetwine to sleep. Princess Daenerys was so frightened by her aunt that she cried whenever she came into her presence. After seven days Rhaena declared that she could no longer sit here idle. “I need to find her. If I cannot find her, at least I can look.” So saying, she mounted Dreamfyre and was gone. Neither mother nor daughter was seen or heard from again during what little remained of that cruel year.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Princess Aerea, Rhaena and Princess Daenerys flew to the Red Keep at Westeros on their dragons. Weaving in between lofty towers, they remained idle and unfrightened as their dragons soared high in the sky. As soon as they landed near the castle entrance, little Aerea declared that she was determined to find her brother here who had disappeared from their kingdom a few months ago. Grand Maester Benifer comforted her with wise words and noble King Jaehaerys reminded them about courage and valor even when surrounded by cruel people and fearsome creatures. They all mounted up again, looking for more clues of what might have happened.

09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.paragraph: * Rogar Baratheon never wed again.
09-Birth, Death, and Betrayal Under King.text-davinci-003: Lord Rogar Baratheon wed Princess Daenerys, the daughter of Rhaena Targaryen, in a secret ceremony that was held at Dragonstone. Despite being far away from Red Keep and King's Landing, many lords such as Lord Velaryon and Lady Alayne Royce still managed to attend the wedding. Incidentally, it was Queen Alyssa Targaryen’s niece Lianna Velaryon who served as one of two witnesses for the marriage. She had been like a star-crossed lover to both Rogar and Rhaena’s brother since their parents wanted them separated due to an ancient feud between their families. As they watched Lord Rogar wed Princess Daenerys, they all remained silent with idle fright even though little did they know that this union would soon transform Westeros into a cruel kingdom ruled by Maegor the Cruel.
